boardgame.name: Dinosauria: New Gen Expansion
boardgame.description:
Having successfully revived a stable, first generation of dinosaurs, it's now time to set bring the next generation to life.

Dinosauria Nex Gen is a stand-alone expansion to Dinosauria, bringing all new dinosaurs to the game, plus two more Colleagues, Rom and Oceana, to play against in Solitaire Mode.

Dinosauria Nex Gen can be played solo, but adds more depth when combined with the Core Dinosauria game.

boardgame.name: Weirdwood Manor
boardgame.description:
Weirdwood Manor is a cooperative board game that marries great adventure gameplay with some euro-inspired underpinnings, as you and your group of valiant companions battle to protect Weirdwood Manor and its enigmatic ruler, Lady Weirdwood, from an invading Fae Monster and his Clockwork Scarab minions.

The Manor is a mysterious and magical place where rooms and the pathways between them can shift as time progresses. The game features a unique temporal mechanic; every time a player or the Fae Monster takes an action, time will move forward in the game and the connections between the rooms will shift via unique rotating corridor rings on the game board. Players have some agency in how to use their actions to affect how quickly (or slowly) time moves, but beware, if the players use up their allotted time and have not defeated the monster, they lose!

You will assume the role of one of six asymmetrically designed characters as you battle against one of the three different Fae Monsters, each with their own unique mechanics and loss conditions. You’ll make use of dice drafting, card play, resource management, and location actions as you move through the ever-shifting Manor in pursuit of the Fae Monster and his minions. You can also recruit additional companions to aid you and you will improve your character’s abilities as you earn experience.

Each turn, the players will use their own deck of cards to take one primary action. Rooms they move to can offer additional actions and benefits. As well, players can make use of their own unique player and companion powers. These combinations can create varied and potentially powerful chains of actions on a player's turn.

However, after each player's turn the Fae Monster will act, using their own custom deck of cards. As the game progresses, the Fae Monster’s strength will grow and things will become more dire for the players so they will have to work together to solve the challenges in front of them. The game offers deep tactical choice and a degree of unpredictability that will make traditional leader quarterbacking virtually impossible; the players will truly have to strategize as a group to succeed as the threat deepens!

And so, if the players can defeat the Fae Monster before time runs out - or before the Fae Monster completes his own unique victory condition, the players will win the game and have kept Weirdwood Manor safe for now... until he next threat arrives!

boardgame.name: Fears and Fathoms
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

It's not safe out there
But for some reason, you and your friends have chosen to go. You have made the conscious decision to go and see the things that go bump in the dark. You know it will change you. Perhaps it already has. After all, would you have gone there before? Were you the kind of person who let their friends drag them into such madness? Or perhaps you were. Perhaps you have led them here.

Perhaps, in time, you will forgive yourself for what you have all become.

Personal Horror
This book is a rules framework inspired by classics like Call of Cthulhu as much as it is by new faces like Blades in the Dark and Apocalypse World.

The game is mainly played rolling dice and having a Discussion with the Keeper about what can and cannot be done. When consequences might befall the investigators, the Keeper will set in how much trouble the character is when making the roll, and the roll allows you to see whether success is achieved easily or at the cost of your equipment, energy, health, or sanity. With time, and in some cases, your characters might develop strange coping mechanisms, or be branded by the Strange, with curses them, making them alien to humanity.

This simple, story-driven system puts players in control of their narrative and how the Strange changes them. Perhaps you will push out the Strange. Perhaps, instead, you will let it brand you, forever barring you from a normal life. This is a game about taking risks and hard bargains in order to get to the truth of a mystery.

You will also find tips and tricks for game masters, as well as a mystery generator for those of you who enjoy a bit of randomness in your writing prompts, and a small mystery to get you started.

I hope to give you all you need to build your own brand of horror, and run with it.

boardgame.name: Keeper Tips
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A gathering of wisdom, advice, and tips from Keepers for Keepers of the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game.

Advice from the Veterans
Tips, essays, and contributions from experienced and diverse Call of Cthulhu Keepers including Jason Durall (RuneQuest), Becca Scott (Good Time Society), Sean Branney (H.P. Lovecraft Historical Society), Allan Carrey (Type40), Lynne Hardy (The Children of Fear) Bridgett Jeffries (The Miskatonic Repository), Mike Mason (Call of Cthulhu), and many, many others!

All Topics Covered
The advice in Keeper Tips is spread across a wide range of topics, including preparation, gameplay, inclusivity, designing scenarios, combat, monsters, horror, sanity, and much more!

Transferable Skills
While the advice in Keeper Tips is specifically geared towards Call of Cthulhu, much of the information is transferable to other games as well. The knowledge in this book is easily ported over to games such as RuneQuest and King Arthur Pendragon!

boardgame.name: ケッコーデス！(Kekko Desu!)
boardgame.description:
You are a mean person who comes to a gift exchange party and wants to collect only the gifts you really want. For that reason, you need to push the gifts you don't want to your friends and only keep the ones you wished for.
Of course, you're not the only one that's mean... Your friends might be even worse than you !

In Kekkou Desu, players try to win as many majorities as possible from the 9 card values in the deck. Depending on their value, the cards have laying effects or end of game effects. On your turn, you will place 1 card from your hand in your "received gifts" area and apply its laying effect if there is one. Then you will choose 1 card from the 3 available in the center of the table to add to your hand. Be careful not to play cards that might interest others too quickly! And don't forget that no one is really a friend here.

Kekkou desu is a light and fast card game. Underneath its nasty look, it is a game that can be played with friends as well as with the family.

listing.notes:
Brand new copy just out from Tokyo Game Market 2022 Spring. Official, direct import from the indie publisher in Nagoya, Japan.
For card payment and streamlined checkout/processing, please also see our online store: https://www.bigcatgames.biz/product/kekkodesu/111?cp=true&sa=true&sbp=false&q=false

boardgame.name: The Game of Twiddleums
boardgame.description:
Players move multiple colored counters from a base on one side of a hexagonal grid to another across numbered spaces, moving only on consecutive numbers. (For instance a counter on 4 can only move onto a 3 or 5 space.) They can be blocked by other players' counters.

An advanced variant allows players to either capture their opponents' counters or send them back to their start positions.

boardgame.name: The SETTAI ~ヘッポコ専務を勝たせろ~
boardgame.description:
The SETTAI ~ヘッポコ専務を勝たせろ~ is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a four-player only cooperative version of Hearts, themed around corporate culture, and trying to keep your boss looking good.

Each round a different player is the Executive Director, and they have four cards in front of them, face-down, which will guide their algorithmic play. During the round, these cards are eventually revealed.

The players may not communicate, but their goal is to have the Executive Director perform the best each round; the scores of the employees are not recorded.

boardgame.name: うかれぽんち (Ukare Ponchi)
boardgame.description:
うかれぽんち (Ukare Ponchi) was a submission to the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards and won the jury prize from one of the jurors, Taiki Shinzawa.

It is a trick-taking game for 3-5 people where the rank of your card is the sum of your card and the card played by the person to your left.

Points are scored for winnings tricks with odd numbers, and if your left neighbor wins no tricks.

After 3 rounds, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Diver's Luck
boardgame.description:
Two players compete to reach 100 on opposing but not completely identical tracks. The theme of the game is deep-sea diving with a beautiful and apparently quite large illustrated board. The visual interest is much of the natural appeal of the game, which is a simple roll-and-move race.

It's a nearly straight drop for the first 25 to 30 spaces on either side. Landing on circled spaces, which become more frequent from that point on, send a player back three spaces. There are a couple of obvious "log jam" areas on either side where players may find themselves circling for several turns.

The game is undated but likely comes from 1910–1920. Brian Love's "Play the Game" (1978) suggests one player is red and one is yellow (matching the tracks on the board), but we do not know if this is supported by the original designers.

boardgame.name: Ascension: Realms Unraveled – Oziah's Familiar Promo
boardgame.description:
Promotional card released with the Ascension Year Four Collector's Edition.

Cost: 4 Runes

Enlightened Hero

Defeat a Monster with cost 4 or less without paying its cost.
Multi-Unite: Repeat this effect.

2 Honor

boardgame.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Black Widow
boardgame.description:
Orphaned as a child, Natasha Romanoff was raised and trained to become a lethal spy before becoming a super-hero and an Avenger. This 30th expansion of Marvel Legendary is filled with heroes and villains from decades past. Black Widow, Red Guardian, Winter Soldier, and the White Tiger join the fight against evil!

Contains:


100 Playable Cards
1 Rules Sheet
5 Heroes! 2 new Masterminds and Villain Groups to watch out for!
All cards contain original art.
Requires the Marvel Legendary Core Set to play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

boardgame.name: Trick Shot (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Trick Shot Second Edition is a tense, tactical, fast-paced game of ice hockey with cool plastic miniatures and a streamlined rule-set. The game strikes a fine balance between luck and strategy, while still being easy to explain and get to the table. Use smart positioning, special abilities of your skaters, and press your luck to outplay your opponent and score the most goals.

This edition offers new abilities for all the Arena cards, introduces new "player cards", introduces multiple improvements to game-play and more.

boardgame.name: Triomphe à Marengo
boardgame.description:
Northern Italy, 14 June, 1800: The outmaneuvered Austrian army attacked the French under Bonaparte, took them by surprise and defeated them quickly in the morning fight. Thinking that the battle was over, they pursued the retreating French. However, when General Desaix arrived with reinforcments in the late afternoon, the French started a defiant counterattack and turned the Battle of Marengo into a glorious triumph.

This game recreates that dramatic battle. One player takes the role of Bonaparte whose troops are scattered at the beginning, while the other attacks with the Austrians. He has to defeat the French, before they can strike back with their reinforcements. Triomphe à Marengo is fast playing. Departing from almost all wargame conventions, it brings the look of the 19th century linear warfare onto the table.

Based on the award winning Bonaparte at Marengo and improving it in many aspects, Triomphe à Marengo offers a unique game experience: The redesigned map gives you wide open spaces for clever maneuvers; the modified combat system is full of drama; and the novel locale-based morale system is nothing but thrill and tension. Since fights are resolved without dice, it's not Dame Fortune who will decide about defeat or victory, but only your maneuver skills.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Fatal Knockout
boardgame.description:
A 2 player card-based fighting game. The aim of the game is to be the last fighter standing in this competitive, tightly-designed fighting game.

Fatal Knockout aims to embody digital fighting games like Smash Bros, Street Fighter and more, and the card play reflects move sets which you would see in the genre. Fatal Knockout comes with six fighters with completely unique decks. Player's play cards which allow them to move, change orientation, and attack on the board. On top of that, each fighter has one-of-a-kind abilities that are triggered by playing cards.

On a player's turn, they draw to their hand up to three cards. The leader of the round places one card face down, the second player follows. At this point the leader can choose to play another card, or reveal. This continues until either the leader reveals all cards or players run out of cards.

Throughout the game, players will be dealing damage to each other with fighter specific cards. The game ends when there is only one fighter left standing, the player left standing is the winner.

Fatal Knockout can be played with just two players, but can also be played in a tournament style where players advance through brackets with the aim of being crowned the winner!

boardgame.name: Capture the Flag
boardgame.description:
Capture your enemy's flag, while also managing to protect yours and win the game.
Use your move points to move your kids around on the map. Use your kids' different abilities to surprise the other player.

Pick the best spots and hit the enemy kids with water balloons enough times that they can't continue the fight.

boardgame.name: Endangered: Monarch Butterfly Scenario
boardgame.description:
The march of humankind’s progress threatens the survival of Monarch Butterflies. It's up to you and your team to save them!

Work with your fellow conservationists to save the Monarch Butterflies from extinction, featuring a new 'drop' mechanic as the butterflies move through the environment.

This is an expansion for Endangered and requires the base game to play.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Interstellar Operations – BattleForce
boardgame.description:
Marshal your forces and prepare to conquer the Inner Sphere! Interstellar Operations: BattleForce provides a sliding zoom that can scale from a quick game on your table up to the macro level, allowing players to assume the roles of House Lords and dominate the galaxy!

BattleForce is a complete, all-in-one-book game system of combat on a grand scale, but tailored to your interest at the gaming table.

Play lightning-fast, large-scale games like battalion vs battalion or conquer a planet with multiple regiments.
Not large enough? Invade an entire sector of a House as armies clash across a dozen systems.
Still not large enough? Become a Clan Khan or House Leader and amass all the industrial might of your empire to protect your worlds and defeat your enemies!
Note: The original publication of Interstellar Operations had rules for playing in alternate eras which can now be found in the Interstellar Operations: Alternate Eras.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Free Rasalhague Republic
BattleTech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Ghost Bear
Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Word of Blake

boardgame.name: Dungeon Fantasy Companion 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pyramid Treasures Return!

Before the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game arrived in the hands of eager fans, new material for it appeared in the pages of Pyramid magazine . . . and support continued until the last issue of that volume.

Now, we collect a trove of those Pyramid goodies – over 20 articles – lightly updated, enhanced with atmospheric art, and designed to fit with the rest of your Dungeon Fantasy RPG collection. Discover new professions like the wrestler and undead-hunter. Unlock new character options, such as gear kits and a background generator. Face new monsters and traps! Go on adventures, including a solo tale perfect to teach the game's basics. And yet more awaits!

boardgame.name: Gilded Suns: Murder in Silverrock
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A whodunnit adventure for any level in which a necklace is just a bit too tight.

A woman is found dead in an alleyway in the dangerous neighborhood of Raven’s Locker in Silverrock. The police are all too eager to shut the case, and the victim’s father – a wealthy gentleman – wants to find out who and why. The players must follow the clues to find out and bring the culprit to justice.

This adventure can be easily adapted to any character level and is written for a 10th-level party.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Interstellar Operations – Alternate Eras
boardgame.description:
Primitive Units. QuadVees. Superheavy 'Mechs. Weapons of Mass Destruction. Robotic and Drone Systems. Land-Air BattleMechs.

As you delve into BattleTech lore, additional weapons, units and rules become available to you and your forces as you fight in the Dark Age, Jihad, or even the depths of the Star League Eras, and all the way back into the Age of War before the birth of the BattleMech.

Alternate Eras introduces a huge swath of rules for playing across the thousand years of BattleTech history, including weapons and equipment mostly unique to a given era.

Note: The original publication of Interstellar Operations had rules for large scale BattleTech play (Strategic BattleForce, Abstract Combat System, and Inner Sphere at War) which can now be found in the Interstellar Operations: BattleForce.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Rivals and Allies: The Sword Lords
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are those who come to power without any noble birthrights to precede them or formal elections to legitimize them. They may have stood during a time of violence and turmoil, taking the burden of leadership upon themselves when no one else could. They may have risen to cause a tide of revolt against the oppression and tyranny of their current rulership. Or they simply may have seized what they believe they and their people deserve from the world around them. Some would call these ambitious self-made leaders warlords. But to those that respect their actions and goals, they’re known as sword lords.

The following are three well-known sword lords within the realms. Each unique NPC description includes how they rose to power, what their goals are, who fights under their banners, and where they reside in Quaseloth, the Underground Oracle campaign setting, or where they can be placed in your own campaign setting of choice.

This supplement includes:

Full information on 3 new NPCs
Greodd - The fisher-turned-corsair captain.
Jona Riese - The young riot sorcerer and rebel leader.
Micalla Erios - A reluctant ex-mercenary thrust into lordship.

Roleplaying tips to help GMs bring each of the above NPCs to life.
6 stat blocks representing each of the sword lords and their average follower.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Battleforce Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description: BattleForce is the BattleTech game of lightning-fast combat. These rules ramp up standard-style game play to a fast-playing system that retains the feel of BattleTech. While the full rules are contained in Strategic Operations, these quick-start rules contain everything needed to play a BattleForce game, including maps and counters.

boardgame.name: Zero Waste Chef Cardgame
boardgame.description:
With this card game, Food Circle aims to bring the value back to food, and for that reason, if you waste food in the game, you lose points.

Each player represents a food organisation, and needs to create meals out of the ingredients they receive. They can also freeze, dehydrate or pickle some ingredients, to save them to use in another moment in the game. For meals they get points.

Each player starts with 1 preservation card, receives ingredient cards on their turn, and can use any recipe. The recipes are open in the middle of the table for everyone to see what they can make.
As chefs, your goal is to collect and trade ingredients to make as many meals with as little food waste as possible. Remember to be strategic: ingredients without a recipe will spoil, and you’ll lose points!

The winner is the player with most points and is declared to be the Zero Waste Chef!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Battleforce Faction Counters – Davion
boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Davion PDF contains a host of faction-specific BattleForce Unit counters for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations (BattleForce symbols are based on the Warfare Symbology section found in Strategic Operations). Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Mercenaries is a free PDF that contains a host of BattleForce Unit counters for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations (BattleForce symbols are based on the Warfare Symbology section found in Strategic Operations). Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Miscellaneous
boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Miscellaneous is a free PDF that contains a host of BattleForce counters from buildings to mines to fire and smoke, all for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations. Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition – Bloody Omaha
boardgame.description:
June 6, 1944, one word is written in letters of blood and fire in the pages of history books, OMAHA! Thanks to this expansion pack for Heroes of Normandie, you can enjoy a beautiful sunny day at the beach or a quiet and bucolic afternoon at the farm.

In the Heroes of Normandie Bloody Omaha Battlepack, relive the terrible landing of the 1st American Infantry Division (Big Red One). In addition to the forces in the basic package, American forces will have at their disposal combat engineers from the Big Red One, a battalion of Rangers, an infantry regiment from the 29th Division and the 743rd American Tank Battalion. The German forces were not left behind and had at their disposal a battalion of the Festungkompanie, Panzer-Aufklarungs and a Panzergruppe of the 2nd Panzer Division to fiercely defend the beach. Let's not forget the addition of the High Command which will allow you to play the American and German air force, but also to rain artillery on your opponent, will you choose the explosive or smoke shells?

New heroes are available for both sides, and a plethora of equipment and support options. Play through 4 scenarios ranging from Omaha beach to a small farm near the coast with 6 new double-sided terrain boards.

One thing is for sure, you'll understand why this beach was infamously renamed 'Bloody Omaha'.

You must own a copy of Heroes of Normandie, the core box, to play with this Battlepack.

— description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition

boardgame.name: Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Steiner
boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Steiner PDF contains a host of faction-specific BattleForce Unit counters for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations (BattleForce symbols are based on the Warfare Symbology section found in Strategic Operations). Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition – Solo Mode
boardgame.description:
You left the family farm to go to war, innocent and naive but full of courage and heroic fantasies. Only, the fighting got the better of your youth, of your hopes. Forced marches, skirmishes, ambushes… the last one went wrong, and you found yourself isolated from the rest of your company.

Alone! The countryside around you pulses with danger. Every grove, every ruined house, seems to harbor a threat. You tighten your grip on your rifle, your brother in arms, and advance towards what you think are the positions of your unit…

The single player mode allows you to play solo, and brings with it a lot of exclusive material. It's a whole new way of playing that you are about to discover. With three levels of difficulty to choose from, you are sure to find an opponent of your size.

With two scenarios to introduce you to the principles of the single player mode, the rule book also brings a list of adaptations allowing you to play (or replay) almost all scenarios released so far for Heroes of Normandie and Heroes of Stalingrad. Be careful, though, the enemy is not always the one you think.

You must own a Heroes of Normandie, or Heroes of Stalingrad Core Box to play this Solo Mode.

— description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition

listing.notes: More LN than VG (but I've used it, so?).

boardgame.name: Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Wolf
boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Wolf PDF contains a host of faction-specific BattleForce Unit counters for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations (BattleForce symbols are based on the Warfare Symbology section found in Strategic Operations). Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Trade Empire-Class Commercial Transport
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you need it carried to another system, the Trade Empire is the ship to do it!

The Trade Empire-class Commercial Transport is a massive 4500 tonne superfreighter. This large vessel is capable of hauling 2670 tonnes of cargo through Earth Sector!

Designed to carry mass quantities of materials for the large corporations in Earth Sector, this superfreighter has been used by corporations to carry cargo, by navies as a replenishment ship, and is sometimes used to carry other starships. Armed with defensive weaponry, the ship can even hold off pirates when needed!

The Trade Empire-class features full deckplans by Michael Johnson alongside beautiful artwork by fan-favorite Ian Stead. The book contains everything you need to know about the Trade Empire-class as well as information on the British Interstellar Company, an Earth Sector transport company.

Load up your cargo! It's time to move!

boardgame.name: Battletech: BattleForce Faction Counters – Word of Blake
boardgame.description: The Faction Counters Word of Blake PDF contains a host of faction-specific BattleForce Unit counters for use with that game system contained in Strategic Operations (BattleForce symbols are based on the Warfare Symbology section found in Strategic Operations). Includes detailed instructions on how to cut out and assemble counters.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: Runecairn: Wardensaga
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a long-forgotten age, a raging war shattered and devastated the worlds of gods and men. Now green life blooms amidst the ruins of the lost worlds. Wondrous and terrible beings roam the Nine Realms. Civilisation stumbles forward, fresh and reaching.

Fate carves the skein anew but there are loose threads, lost long ago in the wars, with no place in the tapestry. These threads must seek the fire within and weave their own path.

Strap on your bearded axe and linden wood shield, delve into the forsaken barrow and cleanse the draugr within. They will overhwhelm you at first so prepare to die. But when you wake up at the bonfire, you'll know what to expect for your next attempt. Parry their attacks, disarm them, and hack them to pieces. Defeat the mad jotunn within and claim the soul remnant they protect.

Death is not the end.

What is Runecairn: Wardensaga?
Runecairn is a Soulslike Norse fantasy RPG by Colin Le Sueur for 1-3 players. Character creation is quick and intuitive, dynamic combat is intense and reactive. Wardensaga combines the Runecairn: Core Rules, introductory dungeon crawl adventure Beneath the Broken Sword, and newly introduced Advanced Rules in an 84-page deluxe edition with cover art from ground-breaking artist CROM.

Wardensaga Features:
Set in a Norse fantasy world some time after Ragnarok
Core gameplay designed for 2 players, one Warden and one Adventurer
Streamlined d20 roll-under rules based on Cairn, Into the Odd, and Knave
Soulslike mechanics such as resurrecting at bonfires, respawning monsters, and dynamic combat
Quickstart dungeon crawl adventure Beneath the Broken Sword, perfect for new players
4 core starting classes: Warrior, Scout, Seer, Skald
2 new advanced classes: Berserkr, Pyre
New options for solo play with a rune-based oracle
New random delve generator for creating Norse dungeons
New options for 3 or more players with summoned allies (jolly cooperation!) and invasions

boardgame.name: Beneath the Broken Sword
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world as you knew it is gone, destroyed in the war that was. You awake in crumbling ruins, lost and trapped in a cycle of death. You must seek the fire within and escape to weave your own fate.

You are an adventurer, lost and adrift. You must navigate the Cave of Echoes, retrieve your weapons and equipment, acquire your mead flask, and overcome the stone demon to escape further into the Nine Realms.

Death is not the end.

Beneath the Broken Sword is a 12-page, black and white adventure for Norse fantasy tabletop RPG Runecairn, and serves as an introductory dungeon crawl for new adventurers.

Beneath the Broken Sword Includes:
Play designed for two players, one Warden and one Adventurer.
12-room tutorial dungeon intended to introduce new players to the system and world of Runecairn.
A dangerous new monster to be overcome, the stone demon.
8 new Omens within the Cave of Echoes to test the Adventurer.

boardgame.name: The Stormy Wedding
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stormy Wedding is a one-shot adventure balanced for four 5th-6th level characters, and is written and designed by Basheer Ghouse, an Indian TTRPG desinger, bringing heavy influences of his culture to the adventure.

After receiving an invitation to a local wedding and rehearsal dinner, the party just can't seem to have a day off, even for something as celebratory as a wedding. With rumors that the betrothed is not who they say they are, and a powerful, respected Djinn who wants nothing but to secure the love of it's life, the party must decide who is telling the truth, ultimately holding the fate of the wedding, and an entire village, in their hands.

The Stormy Wedding is an adventure of love-gone-wrong and love-endures tied together with epic combat, investigative opportunities, and the chance for characters to celebrate through amazing roleplay.

boardgame.name: Squadron Dice
boardgame.description:
Take to the sky commanding a squadron of bi-planes in this exciting head-to-head dice game! Sharpen your aim as your competitors dodge your attack. Call up your flying Aces to take down your opponent’s planes and claim your victory!

Squadron Dice is a game of elimination. First, players roll a set of dice to gain position over other players. Next, the highest and lowest positioned players roll dice again, forcing the lowest positioned player to remove one of their Squadron dice from the game.

A player is eliminated from the game when a player cannot replace a Rookie die with an Aces die after a loss on an Evade roll during a Resolve Phase. When all other players have been eliminated from the game, you win.

boardgame.name: Loose Caboose!
boardgame.description:
There's a caboose on the loose!

Lay down numbered track cards in Loose Caboose! in a race to keep the caboose from going off the rails. The higher the number, the more dice you must roll to move the caboose. Don't let the train derail or else you'll pick up penalty points. End with the lowest score and you've engineered a win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Siege of the Citadel: Boardgame Addons Bundle Expansion
boardgame.description:
Collects some various addons from the Kickstarter in a bundle.

Includes a new hardcover 311 pages Collectors Edition rule book, 5 new playable characters (Tsarina, Sean D’Armatto, Cardinal Durand, Imperial Regia, and Major Tang), a 54-card Doomtrooler Hero Deck to use with Warzone miniatures, and 54-card Mission Generator Deck and 2 defence turret minis

This bundle also includes rulebook PDFs and all the digital stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: Galaxies: The UFO Project
boardgame.description:
Galaxies is a tile-placement game where different combinations will make you score points.

You will have a personalized board where round after round you will have to fill in the holes, the different combinations will score differently.

At the beginning of the round different tiles will be discovered, each astronaut, in turn, will choose a tile and place it on his board in one of the empty holes, that tile can not be moved throughout the game. Each person will have to decide which strategy will be chosen since several combinations are possible.

The points can be obtained either from the tiles or from the mission cards.

The player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Spirit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Astral, Ethereal, Ghost, and Great Old One Monster Lairs in Minutes!
Enjoy quick, easy templates for Game Masters to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with aberrations, celestials, fiends, liches, Great Old Ones, or incorporeal undead like ghosts, wraiths, and specters, as well as for staging battles in the Astral and Ethereal Planes, haunted houses, graveyards, crypts, tombs, temples, and more!

In this Spirit template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Astral Crossroads (magical terrain)
Ethereal Crossroads (magical terrain)
Ghostly Wailing (magical terrain)
Living Nightmare (magical terrain)
Soulstorm (magical weather)

boardgame.name: Oerth Journal (Issue 36 - Spring 2022)
boardgame.description:
Oerth Journal #36 (Vol 3 no. 9)

FESTIVALS OF GREYHAWK
A look at festivals around the Flanaess, and a variety of other articles.
● Father Tabor's Guide to Richfest - by Thomas Kelly
● Richfest in Chathold - by Sam "DMSamuel" Dillon
● Beers of Greyhawk - by James A. S. Muldowney III, M.D.
● Erkill's Skullsplitter - by Mark Allen
● Saltmarsh Festival of Spirts - by Nathan Doyle
● The Desportium of Magick - by Kristoph Nolen
● Never the Heroes, pt2 - by Mark Allen
● Fistful of Baubles, pt3 - by David Leonard
● The Sheltering Ancestors - by Les Reno
● Accursed Fishhooks - by Zach Houghton
● Alvynn Bannocksburn—gnomish merchant - by Paul Jurdeczka
● Seaton - by Casey Brown
● The Best festival of all—GARYCON XI !!!!
boardgame.rpgdesigner: James A. S. Muldowney, III, MD

boardgame.name: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard QuickStart Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Savage Fantasy Frontier Awaits! Iron wielding human city-states rise up across a stone age world with a dark past.

Introducing the Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard quickstart rules. This publication includes all of the basic rules required to play the Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard roleplaying game.

This pdf includes:
The Beast of Murghadem – Adventure set in a prehistoric, fantasy swampland.
Five level 3 pregenerated characters
Combat and magic rules
Two unique spell lists
Two Adventure maps
Bonus full color map of the town of Raven's Stand, illustrated by Janice E. Sheen (Misjay Maps)

The contents are suitable for 2 to 5 participants to play in the world of Sonnegard.

boardgame.name: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard Advanced Magic Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternate ruleset for spell resource management.

Introducing the Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard Advanced Magic Rules. This publication includes rules for transitioning from a daily spell magic system to a point driven resource system.

This pdf includes:

Conversion tables from Spells per Day to Magic Points
New or revised abilities for each of the spell casting classes in S&SoS
New Deity: Set
New Spellsheets

boardgame.name: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard Player's Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Savage Fantasy Frontier Awaits!

Explore a world of lost ruins, prehistoric beasts, and horrors from the void. Choose from one of ten archetypes to model your persona! Whether you play as a battle hardened warrior, a stoic druid, or a tribal shaman, adventure awaits in the dusty city streets, and the wild frontiers of Sonnegard.

This book contains everything you need to participate as a player in the tabletop roleplaying game: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard.

This includes:
rules for creating characters
rules for character advancement
equipment and weapons lists
combat and magic rules
deities
four unique spell lists
four unique playable races
ten character archetypes

boardgame.name: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard Game Master's Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Master of the Realms of Sonnegard.

Create ancient lairs, and weave fantastic stories of swords and sorcery as you tell the tales of Sonnegard. As a Game Master, you are the narrator of fantastic settings and adventures for the players in the game

This book contains the rules and additional background you will need to host the tabletop roleplaying game: Swords & Shaman of Sonnegard as a Game Master.

This includes:

rules and guides for running campaigns
new playable races
creature creation rules
a playable mini-campaign
creatures of Sonnegard
maps and locales

boardgame.name: Baby Shower: The Card Game
boardgame.description: You have just had your baby shower and now the gifts are everywhere. Collect matching cards to organize your new baby swag, but there is so much that gets in the way! Roll the dice to get through going to the bathroom, needing a snack, etc...Who can organize their gifts the fastest?

boardgame.name: Imminent Respawn
boardgame.description:
Transports crystals along a short path to score them or frag players to score crystals and spaceships. Players will call upon specialized spaceships which immediately take effect but place limitations on the player too. Nothing lasts forever as a respawn is always imminent!

Battle back and forth dealing out fatal blows, reflect attacks or even directly score from another player's cargo.

Cloak, warp and upgrade ships whilst strategically decoding the opposition's next move.

Players play crystals and spaceships on their turn or alternatively move with the option to play additional cards to boost forward, gain a core action or purchase a community crystal.

The first to score 15 points worth of crystals and/or spaceships wins!

boardgame.name: The Great Bork Team
boardgame.description:
(From the back of the Zine):

The Great Bork Team is a 3-player RPG that Celebrates teamwork, endurance, cleverness, and the value of family and home. Will you and your team of strong, fast doggos be able to pull your hoomin to safety through a variety of obstacles and new experiences? through danger and wonder, BORK your way through the icy vastness to reach your goal (and score some delicious treats on the way).

boardgame.name: Darklight: Memento Mori – Saim Lab Insert
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with Darklight Memento Mori + Boss pack + Adventurers Pack. It keeps sleeved cards.

boardgame.name: ONUS! Pack
boardgame.description:
ONUS! Pack, this board game includes the previous titles of the ONUS! series:
• Rome vs Carthage (Punic Wars).
• Greeks and Persians (Peloponnesian and Greco-Persian Wars).
• Macedonians (Philip II, Alexander the Great, Philip V).
• Special mercenaries (Spartacus, gladiators, Cimbrian warriors, etc.).
• Campaigns book (Book with around 100 pages, with 40 scenarios for the game ONUS! divided into 6 campaigns: The Hispanic Campaign (Second Punic War), Greco-Persian Wars, Greek Wars, The Rise of Macedonia, Macedonian Wars and the Gladiatorial War.

And:
• 200+ Unit Cards
• 20+ General Cards
• 90+ Action Cards
• 200+ Markers
• 1 Rulebook
• 1 Scenario Book
• Solo Mode Rules

boardgame.name: Party of 4: Fortunes Found in Dungeons Deep
boardgame.description:
Party of 4: Fortunes Found in Dungeons Deep is a physical SOLO Hero-crafting, Dungeon-delving and Treasure-looting board game. Assemble a Party of wannabe Heroes, Train them to “not die too fast” and then Point them towards Fame and Fortune (or humiliating Defeat and Destitution)! Party of 4 is a physical game; not digital or Print-n-Play.

Heroes may be forged in battle or molded by the mysteries of the Arcane or toughened in shadowy urban alleyways, but first they must be (dice) rolled into existence.

Enroll your Adventurers in the best schools, academies and apprenticeships in the Realm (as long as they are super cheap and have crazy low admissions standards, anyway). Recruit graduates (or loser dropouts!) to form a Party of 4 heroically brave and / or extremely gullible Adventurers to Explore Forgotten Ruins, Battle Fearsome Monsters and Loot Unique Treasures (or everything that is not nailed down... and maybe even some things that ARE nailed down!).

Players create characters, train them and send them on dungeon crawling adventures to gather loot. The game ends when the characters return from dungeon (or die trying).

boardgame.name: Ruins: Death Binder – Tribes of Myrtia
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Ruins: Death Binder board game that adds new enemies, action cards, tokens and bunch of mechanics.

- Defeat Tribe Leaders to gain Trophies
- Exchange Trophies for unique Action Cards
- Combat Tribes of higher-level whenever you feel so
- Expansion speeds up each Descent by ~10-15%
- Defense Mechanic for new Enemies
- Battered Soul Mechanic – when you die, your soul stays in the Ruins, find and defeat it to retrieve part of lost strength.

boardgame.name: The First Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Candlekeep-led expedition into The Feywild brings with it the chance to unravel the legend of The First Forest; the sentient source of feywild flora and fauna and ancestor to all woodlands. The enclave’s journey takes them to an altered autumnal land, which its wondrous warden nurtures with a blustery hand. Can our adventurers aid their benefactors on this journey to discovery? Will they be blown over by the unraveled secrets? Can they overcome the cold shoulder of an acrimonious archfey? Even more challenging, can they overcome themselves?

The first of four adventures in the Soul of the Forest series was written for and premiered at Gary Con XIV. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Content Warning: Pet endangerment (none harmed)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Soul of The Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Our heroes continue to explore the domains of the Feywild, hoping to unravel the legend of The First Forest, the sentient source of Feywild nature and ancestor to all woodlands. Their journey takes them to a hot, sticky summer realm, where the land and its people are missing their archfey and strangled within an ever-growing jungle. Can our adventurers discover the true cause of this jungle blight? Can they overcome the obstacles in their path and find the solution to save this realm? And what about the missing archfey?

The second of four adventures in the Soul of the Forest series written for and premiered at Gary Con XIV. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Dungeons and Dinos
boardgame.description:
Dungeons and Dinos is a family-friendly card game that finds inspiration from the elements, tropes, and iconic characters of Dungeons and Dragons and other role-playing games. Fast-paced and silly, you play as a group of Nomnisaurs that romp around the house on a grand "adventure" full of make-belief magic, construction paper, and costumes!

Assemble your forces as you'll need to defeat fearsome baddies like the quivering Gelatinous Ooze (Jello) or the ferocious Dire Woof (family pet), loot every shiny thing you come across, and steal kills from everyone else to say that you won more than they did in this (mostly) cooperative experience!

With nothing more than a party of 3 Noms and 2 pieces of starting gear, you'll immediately clash paper towel swords and throw glow sticks at wave after wave of baddies as you delve deeper into the heart of a "dungeon" in search of the BIG BAD. Just remember to use the cards you acquire on your journey to subdue foes, defend your fellow adventurers, and heal them up with snacks as you pile on trophies to your ever expanding collection!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Of Pumpkins and Promises
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Our heroes’ journey takes them deeper into the mysterious domains of the Feywild, seeking more clues about the First Forest. In the cold Domain of Delight, known as Haratath (Ha-RA-teth), there are horrible noises in the night and strange sounds heard throughout the day. The local denizens live in a state of constant fear. Can our adventurers put a stop to these terrors? Or will they assist the devil they know for the greater good?

The third of four adventures in the Soul of the Forest series, written for and premiered at Gary Con XIV. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Peace Talks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Our heroes continue to explore the domains of the Feywild, hoping to unravel the legend of The First Forest, the sentient source of Feywild nature and ancestor to all woodlands. Their journey takes them to a peaceful yet stagnant spring realm, where the archfey provides an uneventful safe haven for its denizens. Will the adventurers convince the fey to sacrifice their home to return the First Forest, or is there another path? And, who brought the bad weather?

The fourth of four adventures in the Soul of the Forest series which were written for and premiered at Gary Con XIV. A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

CONTENT WARNING: children in peril, natural disasters
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Forbidden Stars: Geekmod Insert
boardgame.description: Wooden organizer compatible with Forbidden Stars, made from 3mm birch plywood

boardgame.name: Grün heißt gegen, rot bleibt stehen!
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space "Start". The first to reach space 94 "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces cards are drawn which contain traffic situations that hinder or benefit the players.

If a player gets on a space with a traffic sign, he has to explain the sign to advance 1 space. If he can't do this, he has to go 2 spaces back.

boardgame.name: The Sherlock Files: Vol V – Marvelous Mysteries
boardgame.description:
Marvelous Mysteries includes three new confounding cases to solve.


Fabian Essays - Investigate the mysterious death of a Victorian lawyer. Has his spirit returned to accuse his murderer?
The Forgery - Follow the trail of a famous masterpiece that may have been replaced by a forgery!
Murder on the Sind Mail - Crack the case of a high speed homicide, where one man's train trip to Pakistan takes a deadly swerve off the rails.


For each case you will follow the clues, piece together the evidence, and then identify who did it, how, and why.
This is a completely standalone game, and does not require any other Sherlock Files games to play.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Sherlock: Asesinato en el Sind Mail

boardgame.name: Barrage: Saim Lab Insert
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with the board game Barrage + exp. The Leeghwater project.

boardgame.name: Belfort 10th Anniversary: Saim Lab Insert
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with the board game Belfort + The Expansion + Her Majesty's civil service, 10th Anniversary. It keep premium sleeved cards

boardgame.name: Edge of Darkness: Saim Lab Insert
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with the board game Edge of Darkness + Sands of Dunestar + Cliffs of Coldharbor + Guilds power pack kickstarter edition. It keeps sleeved cards
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Edge of Darkness: Cliffs of Coldharbor
Edge of Darkness: Guilds Power Pack Expansion
Edge of Darkness: Sands of Dunestar

boardgame.name: Der Kampf um den Himalaja
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 70 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinder-Kalender 1938.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Ghost Stories: Saim Lab Insert
boardgame.description: Organizer compatible with the board game Ghost Stories + exp. White Moon + Black secret. It keep sleeved cards

boardgame.name: Zoologisches Kettenspiel
boardgame.description:
The 18 cards are dealt equally among the players. The player who got the "Aal" places the card on the table. Now the player with an animal beginning with a "L" places his card behind the "Aal" card and so on, building a chain of cards. If a player has to place 2 cards after another, he has to take the first card in the chain. If a player has to place 3 cards he has to take 2 cards from the front of the chain.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinder-Kalender 1919. The cards had to be cut out from the paper sheet and glued on cardboard. Gifted children were encouraged to color the cards.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: The Stranger: A Wasteland Wanderer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's something strange in the neighbourhood!

Some wastelands are weirder than others. Alien visitations, dimensional rifts opening the way for interdimensional horrors, travellers from a far flung future, ghostly manifestations–all these and more are possible in the wilder wasteland worlds. Wastelanders who are exposed to such forces or events are often changed by them, gaining forbidden knowledge and inexplicable powers. They become Strangers.

Add some weird to your wasteland.

A companion to Wasteland Wanderers, The Stranger: a Wasteland Wanderer is compatible with all the books in the Wasteland Worlds product line and introduces a new class to the game. When the Guide wants to introduce supernatural, alien, or other inexplicable elements to their wasteland world, the Stranger class lets players lean into the strange and unusual side of the setting.

The Stranger class, and 5 archetypes:
The Corrupted gains powers from a symbiotic entity: an Alien, Horror, Machine, or Plant (making this 4 archetypes in 1!)
The Gizmoperator has come into possession of a gizmo, an impossibly advanced device of unknown origin.
The Mathomancer sees, exploits their knowledge of, and tweaks the rules that underpin reality.
The Remembrancer has power over memories, and is able to read memories imprinted on objects or psionically project memories to befuddle the minds of thise around them.
The Warpweaver draws and wields energy from the weakening barriers between dimensions to teleport and dole out destruction.
75 possible powers for your Stranger to wield, and guidance for converting spells into new powers.
75 oddities to further customise your Stranger.
The Olddlore skill, representing knowledge of the strange.
1 new background, the Outsider.
2 new feats, and recommendations for using feats from other sources.

boardgame.name: City of Merv
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With one of your associates deceased, an old map shows you are near the City of Merv where a resurrection stone is rumored to be present. You load up the body and head in that direction only to discover that Merv appears to have been sundered!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for six, mid (4th) level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Hypercorps
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

YOU HAVE ACCESSED MOTO.TRONICA’S DATASPHERE!

DO YOU HAVE AN APPOINTMENT?

Hypercorps, megacorps, empresas. The corporate battlefields of the Human Sphere are as vicious as a Friday night at the Gambate Cantina and as deadly as Paradiso’s Cauchemar cats. From the top-tier lobby backstabbing in Santiago di Neoterra and Concilium Prima to the very real backstabbing among Submondo’s most vicious criminals, the hypercorps’ influence permeates every aspect of humanity’s existence.

Leviathans of apparent corruption, lacking soul and empathy, the hypercorp is the epitome of all of society’s sins and injustice, or so the hard-line terrorists rant in the deep corners of Maya and Arachne. Yet, the hypercorps sustain billions of people all around the galaxy, and no matter what the general consensus, they are here to stay for the hypercorp is the very essence of the Human Sphere.

Before there was PanOceania and the Second Great Space Race, the hypercorp was already gestating, pushing humanity into space, into greatness through the development of technologies and new political systems. The great nations (yes, even the Nomads!) owe much to the hypercorp!

Of course, the hypercorporations of the future are also responsible for the worst tragedies the Human Sphere has suffered since before the coming of the Evolved Intelligence. Indeed, the stories of tragedies like Helicon, the Caledonian Massacres, Luna, Jupiter, even the Japanese Uprising all include one or more hypercorps with bloodied hands.

Necessary evil, virulent cancer on society, or beacons of light in the darkest moment of humankind’s history? However you decide to approach them, remember this: the hypercorps’ power extends their tentacles all over the Human Sphere, and if you awake their anger, there is nothing that will stop them until they own you and everything dear to you.

The Hypercorps Sourcebook includes:

The detailed story of the hypercorps and the Human Sphere, from the Incorporated States’ foiled attempts to the PanOceanian political lobbies.
The most renowned and powerful hypercorps in the galaxy, their areas of influence, ambitions, and hostile take-over tactics!
Corporate adversaries. From the lowest errand boy to the haughtiest Executive Officer, they are all willing to live by their company’s code of values and attain the coveted Loganto status!
Ideas on how to run a campaign with the real villains and heroes of the Human Sphere–the hypercorp–at its center.
Rules on how to create and run your own hypercorp, megacorp, or even the humble corporation!

boardgame.name: Shen Battler Aurora
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a space beyond our reach, just across the Path of Shen, lies another world – the world of Materia. Once a paradise, it was overwhelmed by the power of sorcerer kings and yoked to their unbending law. But that changed when defiant humans from Earth travelled to Materia and triggered a long-brewing revolution. The magical lords were overthrown, and the Path between their world and ours was shattered. But that was long ago.

Today the space between our worlds thins, and humans have begun to cross over once more, bringing new ideas, new challenges, and the most valuable force on Materia: the power of Shen. The Iron Khan hungers for these people, for only those marked with the Power can bring to life his magical clockwork war machines – the Shen Battlers.

Shen Battler Aurora is a fantasy setting using the Mecha vs Kaiju ruleset. This alternate reality combining soul magic and clockwork science sits adjacent to the MvK world, accessible to only a select few. It can also stand-alone as an independent setting.

Shen Battler Aurora features

A complete magic system allowing players to craft spells, artifacts, and alchemy using mecha and kaiju abilities.
Rules for creating Battlers, mecha powered by the pilot's own spirit, or Shen.
Magical Traditions (Stunts) such as Druid Craft and Potions Master.
A complete setting with history, locations, and 9 different races, including the small elemental Kinth and the winged Feigh.
A Blighted land where the once noble Dragons have become insane ravagers due to the theft of Shen, the magical life force of the world.
Four different campaign seeds for using this sourcebook independantly, as a crossover with the Mecha vs Kaiju world, or any other existing Fate camplaign, all opposing the might of the master of Materia, the Iron Khan.

boardgame.name: My Corner of the Sky
boardgame.description:
After years of diligent research and learning, you've finally been granted what every young astronomer dreams of: dedicated time on your local planetarium's telescope. Determined to make the most of the five weeks you've been granted, you've pledged to spend the time mapping Mihi Anguli, an obscure and uncharted patch of the night sky. But beware! Your colleague and nemesis Dr. Rivalis is eager to piggyback off of your success. For you to prevail, you must learn new abilities, gain supporters, and publish your findings. Only then will the world see you as the superior astronomer. Now go forth, and carpe noctem!

My Corner of the Sky is a roll & write game, released in Spring 2022 by Dave Mansell as a free print & play. It features an innovative dice mechanic wherein the pip layout of your dice matters as much as the value shown. It has two pages of rules and one game sheet. The only other needed components are a pencil (or pen) and 4 standard 6-sided dice (with pips).

This is a solo game but can also be played as multiplayer, with all players using the same rolled dice values.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Fruit of Untash & Kumis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A classic double-adventure release from Menagerie Press. The Fruit of Untash (level 3-4) features a forgotten pyramid, and Kumis (level 1-2) has the adventurers delivering an enchanted brew to a solstice festival.

A pair of 5E adventures for 1st-4th level characters.

boardgame.name: Kumis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original D&D 5e adventure for level 1-3 characters

The adventurers are hired to transport hallucinogenic fermented mare’s milk to a solstice festival. The route leads through the Shalak Bog, an expansive wetland that requires magical mounts to traverse. Saddle up your water-striding insect mount, there’s kumis to deliver!

boardgame.name: Synthicide: Sharpers in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Synthicide is a best-selling game that released in 2017. It debuted a grimdark cyberpunk setting where players take on the role of interstellar criminals known as sharpers. This title is the re-release of Synthicide using the Forged in the Dark system known as Synthicide: Shapers in the Dark.

In Synthicide, the Galaxy has entered a dark age where human life has no value. Sharpers have to fight for their lives, while trying to earn enough money for food and spaceship fuel.

If you loved the original Synthicide, this is a chance to experience its galaxy in a whole new way. The planets are updated to provide location-specific mission ideas, and the baked in faction system brings the galaxy to life.

If you’re a fan of the Forged in the Dark engine and new to Synthicide, try the game to see how Synthicide’s grimdark, lethal cyberpunk themes are expressed in a perfectly suited system.

boardgame.name: Aktion Futterraufe
boardgame.description:
Each player gets 14 numbered tokens and places then on the corresponding spaces on his half of the game board. Movement is one space in any direction. The players move to get their tokens on the corresponding spaces on the opposite side of the board (mangers).

Opposite tokens may be taken by jumping over them to an empty space. Tokens that are already on their destination manger may not be jumped over.

At the end of the game the numbers of all tokens on their mangers are added and the player with the highest result wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Kadoova Dash
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is simple, roll your way to 10,000 points first, and stay there ahead of the other players. The heart of the game however is really all about using your cards to effectively get in the other player's way and stop them from getting there before you or steal their points if they get to 10,000 first.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Reiver's Lament
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cross swords with the notorious Border Reivers of 16th Century Scotland!

You are The Young Scotsman. You live in a perilous land, where rival clans will kill for honor, wealth and status, where the English are ready to cross the border in a bloody invasion, and your own Scottish government is always capable of swooping down and massacring anyone they feel is causing mischief.

There is a dark secret somewhere in the hills of the Western March. People are disappearing without a trace, no ransom asked, no threats made. And your family has gotten the blame.

Your brother is now in deep trouble, in the rough hands of a foreign power. He is counting on you to save him. Your friends expect you to find a way out of this dangerous situation. Your clan relies on you to uphold the family honor, and not get your kinfolk into more trouble than they already face.

You have a magnificent horse and your trusty broadsword at your hip. Your resourceful, well-armed friends are ready to help. You have the support of your clan, and the hard won skills of a life in the treacherous borderlands. Hard men are aligned against you, men who kill without hesitation. There is some kind of lethal mystery afoot that has already cost many people their lives.

Do you have what it takes to navigate your way across the misty, moss covered land, cross the dangerous border, and get to the bottom of this nightmare?

The Reiver’s Lament is a historically based adventure module set in 16th century Scotland. It is designed for use with the Codex Martialis historical combat system. It is designed as a stand-alone adventure. It comes with historical maps of the region, towns and castles, as well as detailed descriptions of towns, tables of markets with equipment and prices, standardized and specific NPCs and both random and planned encounters. It is intended for 3-5 characters of levels 5-7, made for a low-magic, historical setting, with strong elements of occult horror thrown into the mix.

This is an immersive, fast paced, dynamic adventure, which your characters can really sink their teeth into. As tension and fear build, the Codex rules will allow them to apply their most devious fighting tricks and strategies to defeat perilous enemies from the history books, and from the legends right out of the fairy tales of centuries past. If you are looking for a world that feels real enough to be dangerous, but is still remote enough for great adventures, The Reiver’s Lament is your gateway to a historical reality which is stranger than fiction.

This module is made for the Codex Martialis OGL system, and is essentially version agnostic but is easily adaptable to Pathfinder, to 5e or to various OSR systems. It is designed to be Low Magic and mid-to low-level play, but is highly customizable, so that GMs and players can make it their own. Take a step to a realm just adjacent to the fantasy genres you know so well, but is full of surprising twists and turns that are fresh and interesting fodder for gripping gameplay.

This module works as both a sandbox, with resources sufficient for multiple adventures, and also as a structured wilderness campaign and substantial 'dunegon crawl'.

boardgame.name: Barangay Bound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s time for Ali to follow her dream and head to the next big town, Barangay. But the Encanta Forest is far too dangerous to traverse by oneself. Do you mind helping the young pixie move?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This adventure takes place in Maykanta, a Domain of Delight.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Tales of the Infinite Planes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore the World Serpent Inn and the Multiverse with 8 Adventures.

Adventures previously released have been collected into one convenient package.
...
World Serpent Inn provides a broad overview of the World Serpent Inn, a planar hub and potential home base for any band of planar adventurers. It’s a bustling place of infinite doors and infinite possibilities, and includes a host of patrons who could provide jobs for adventurers and sprawling, unknown sites worth exploring. This section also includes details on using the World Serpent Inn as a Group Patron along with five detailed encounters used to introduce and adventure within the mysterious planar tavern.

Jade Waters Job is a 2nd-level scenario that takes the party to the City of Glass on the Plane of Water in the employ of a marid merchant. Once in the metropolitan planar city, the marid is robbed, and the thieves take refuge in the frozen underworld of the city where no patrols dare enter.

Trial of the Wine Lord is a 3rd-level scenario featuring Bacchus, Lord of Wine, being accused of criminal activities in the elven realm on the plane of Arborea. The quest to clear Bacchus’ name takes the party across the first two layers of Aborea to find the truth.

Jewel of the First Khan is a 5th-level scenario set on the Plane of Earth. The characters find the resting place of a fabulous jewel possessed by the first Great Khan of the Dao, but it seems they may be too late – leading into a hunt for the thief.

Roots of the Hungry Mine is a 7th-level scenario set on both Twin Paradies of Bytopia. It seems a mining operation on the wild layer has gone silent and the surveyor who found it needs help figuring out what happened.

Dreams of Brass is a 9th-level scenario focused on the City of Brass in the Plane of Fire. A plot to overthrow the Grand Sultan pulls the characters into unfolding events involving a cult of water worshippers and a displaced salamander queen.

Vault of Dusk is an 11th-level scenario taking the party to the Plane of Faerie. The fallen elven city of Cendriane has long attracted treasure-seekers, and the characters must navigate its dark streets in order to find a site of incredible power before a band of drow beat them to it.

Riddle of Hate is a 13th-level scenario that unfolds on Elysium, a normally peaceful plane of rugged individuality and good nature. Some sinister forces have infiltrated the plane and the party stumbles onto their devising in a journey into the mysterious swampy layer of Elysium.

Labyrinth of Scorn is a 15th-level scenario that serves as a follow-up to Riddle of Hate. Now, the party is tasked with taking on a minotaur king in his own labyrinth lair on Gehenna, but before that they must find the Crawling City of the yugoloths and pull off a daring art heist.

boardgame.name: Hellbound
boardgame.description: Classic First Person Shooter style game. Like the good old days. An action game focused on speed, gore, guns, and metal music. Inspired by the 90s’ classics with modern visuals and audio! (Steam Store Page)

boardgame.name: Atera Redux Zine (Issue 1 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description: The Mounts Issue! The first issue of an ongoing zine which will feature homebrew mounts, monsters, magical items, etc. Each mount in this issue has its own illustration, personalized saddle type, and stats for 5e, Fate, and Mazes rpg/Polymorph.

boardgame.name: Dread Templar
boardgame.description: Dread Templar is a fast-paced retro FPS that combines 90s classic shooter elements with modern skill-based FPS controls. You are a Dread Templar who entered Hell seeking revenge. But in order to get it, you have to fight your way through the dark realm! (Steam Store Page)

boardgame.name: Atera Redux Zine (Issue 2 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description: The second issue of the ongoing Atera Redux zine contains 8 original monsters. Each has its own illustration, description, and stats compatible with 5e, Fate RPG, and Mazes RPG systems.

boardgame.name: Assassin's Hideout
Miniaventura: Esconderijo do Assassino
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Antigas histórias falam do esconderijo de um homem que acumulou riquezas trabalhando de assassino. Apenas uma frase foi deixada de dica para encontrar o local. Será que são apenas histórias?

Ancient stories tell of a famous assassin who could kill anyone in three days, no matter where or whoever they were. His price was always the target's weight in gold, metals, or gemstones, making his services quite expensive. According to legends, this assassin had a hiding place in the forest where he waited for new jobs and hid his payments. Rumors now say that he died at the hands of age, and then, ambitious people fill the forest behind his hiding place. One of them says that has a tip that will lead to the hideout, and she just hasn't done it yet because she needs reliable people to help her in such endeavor.

boardgame.name: Barrier Against Darkness
Miniaventura: Barreira Contra as Trevas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

O forte que protege uma das fronteiras do reino está sob constante ataque de criaturas oriundas das trevas. Aventureiros são chamados para tentar acabar com este sofrimento, será que conseguirão?

The military fort that protects one of the kingdom's borders is facing dark creatures for almost a year. They try to invade the kingdom under the command of one person who calls himself Emperor, an ancient wizard who is rumored to have made a pact with darkness and obtained the power to command dark armies. As members of the kingdom's armed forces are dedicated to containing its advances, assassins and people of courage are hired to eliminate the Emperor, and thus stop such terror.

boardgame.name: Choosing a Hero
Miniaventura: Escolhendo um Herói
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Um velho mago aguarda pacientemente que uma profecia se cumpra, segundo ele o novo herói entrará pela porta da taberna e passará em sua provação. Quem será este escolhido?

In a small town tavern an old wizard waits for a warrior destined for glory to pass his test. This wizard had a dream a few years ago that he considers prophetic, a powerful person would come and drink wine at his table, after that he would be responsible for great deeds and fortunes. As the rumor spreads, various candidates appeared, but none of them were the right person according to the wizard's dream. The rumors became stories and were put aside, but the wizard still remain observant: whenever someone sits by his side, he applies challenges to them in order to find the hero he had dreamed of.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth of the Mind
Miniaventura: Labirinto da Mente
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mensageiros são enviados para atestar a sanidade de um mago, o que pode dar errado?

Rumors begin to circulate that the magician of the kingdom is losing his lucidity. As he renders services to royalty, his presence is summoned from time to time, but in the last month he only responded to calls with an incomprehensible letter. The royalty has come to consider him useless, ignoring him, but a noble is concerned and intends to visit his tower to better understand what is happening to the mind of such a powerful and wise individual. A small group of his trust was requested to accompany him on this journey, as if rumors are confirmed a mad mage is something quite dangerous.

boardgame.name: Lake Beer
Miniaventura: Cerveja do Lago
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma cidade cervejeira está sofrendo com a contaminação de seu tão estimado produto. Todos desconfiam que o problema seja a água utilizada, será verdade?

A city is famous for its beer production. This is due to the huge lake of crystalline waters within its borders, using this natural resource in all processes, from the agriculture of the ingredients to the distillery. However, recently, the beer that met the various quality standards has a bad taste and is even contaminated, causing discomfort and making those who consume it sick.. Producers believe that the lake water is responsible, so they are looking for people capable of solving the problem that affects the local economy.

boardgame.name: Lost on the Island
Miniaventura: Perdidos na Ilha
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

O barco da realeza naufragou próximo a uma ilha remota. Uma equipe de resgate foi organizada para trazê-los em segurança, será que conseguirão?

The vessel carrying the royalty sank when facing a sudden storm. Its members were on such a sea voyage with diplomatic intentions, going to visit a kingdom of interest with a proposal for a commercial and military union. The information that reached the coast was that the tragedy occurred near a small uncivilized island that is in the route. The nobility's assumption is that they may be alive and sheltered on such an island, and that they must be rescued. An expedition funded by the kingdom was organized in order to rescue them, or at least find out what happened to the bearers of the crown.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Vidas Ofertadas
Offered Lives
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma seita sinistra se esgueira pelas vielas do bairro pobre da cidade sequestrando pessoas. Qual será o objetivo deles?

A sect devoted to the god of plenty is sacrificing innocent people in the poor neighborhood of a big city. They take advantage of the dead of night to kidnap the most vulnerable, who are taken to a hiding place in the sewers and offered on a burning altar. Rumors circulate about this fact and complaints are made to the guard, however, it is neglected due to the financial situation of the place. Some residents with a better condition, and who have lost family members, got together to hire people capable of solving the situation.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Renovação na Coroa
Renewal in the Crown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A coroa do reino está demorando pouco tempo na cabeça de alguém, um novo sucessor foi encontrado, mas será que ele não terá o mesmo fim dos que o antecederam?

The crown of the kingdom is short-lived on one's head, plots and murders are creating great fickleness in the royals. The next heir in the line of succession has just been summoned and an entourage will come for him. Fearing further conspiracies on the part of the royal guard, one of the nobles is summoning adventurers and/or mercenaries to accompany him on this journey and ensure that the successor to the crown arrives safely.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Furto do Cofre
Safe Theft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Um baile tradicional está acontecendo na casa de um nobre, no decorrer da noite uma noticia abala todos, o cofre foi roubado! Todas as portas são trancadas, ninguém entra ou sai até o culpado ser pego!

It is tradition that on the first day of spring a family of aristocrats from the city offers a huge banquet. All those with some wealth are invited: priests, shopkeepers, and members of the guard are the most commonly included in this realm of nobility. However, this year's festivities were rocked by a robbery. In the middle of the night it was announced that the safe in the masters' room had been breached, and that the jewels inside had disappeared. The guard members expressed control and cordoned off the place, no one leaves or enters until the stolen goods are recovered and the crime is solved.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Segredo do Imortal
Secret of the Immortal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Um criminoso sentenciado a morte se mantêm vivo mesmo após várias execuções. A realeza está intrigada como aquele homem atingiu a imortalidade. Os boatos se espalharam e agora todos estão buscando este segredo.

A criminal was sentenced to death after proving his responsibility for a heinous crime. His immediate punishment was the gallows, but it was ineffective. Intrigued, those responsible tried other methods, cut off his head, drowned him, burned him… none of that helped, after a few hours of execution he came back to life. The case drew a lot of attention, especially from the kingdom's royalty, soon torture was authorized for him to reveal the origin of his immortality, but no information was obtained. The rumor spread quickly along with the royal guard's announcement, whoever manages to obtain the secret of immortality will receive a huge reward.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Nevasca Manchada
Stained Blizzard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma caravana mercante se perdeu em uma nevasca, o resgate dos produtos e dos comerciantes é requisitado. Será que ainda tem alguém vivo ou algo para encontrar?

A merchant caravan made up of large wagons was caught in a blizzard on the road, not reaching its destination. The disappearance is worrying the merchants who were waiting for it, not only because of the financial loss but because none of the lost ones made it to any nearby town or village. As the days go by the chances of rescuing someone alive decrease dramatically, even more so during winter. A new rescue caravan is being organized with few members and a few sleds to be as fast as possible.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Coração Roubado
Stolen Heart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
