O ciúme descontrolado levou a um crime horrível que mancha a reputação de uma pessoa importante na cidade. Até onde está loucura vai?

Due to an uncontrolled jealousy, a warrior tore out her lover's heart and fled. The case took place less than a week ago and shocked everyone in the city. The warrior, renowned and famous, carried out such a crime openly in a street behind a tavern. Rumors say that it was all motivated by the flirtatious behavior of the man, who was constantly cheating on her. The fact drew so much attention from the authorities that they placed a prize on the warrior's head.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Tomada de Território
Territory Takeover
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uma pequena tribo se instalou nas fronteiras do reino, o que não foi bem visto. Tentativas de acordo falharam, agora somente resta a retomada do território!

A small tribe of savage humanoids has settled within the kingdom's borders. With its own political and cultural system, the crown is not accepting this “savage” people. Attempts at agreements and political submission did not end well, the tribe responded with violent attacks. Naturally the kingdom regarded this as an open declaration of war, and was prepared to drive them out or even exterminate them. Avoiding to commit the army and the royal guard to this clash, mercenaries are being hired everywhere, as long as they know how to wield weapons.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: A Princesa no Castelo
The Princess in the Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A princesa está presa no quarto mais alto da torre mais alta aguardando o seu resgate, seria você esse herói?

Due to a horrible curse that besets his daughter, the king has decided to keep her isolated in a castle far from the city for her protection. The curse was placed at the behest of a conspirator against the crown, no one knows its real effect, only that it affects the princess from dawn to dusk. Due to the castle being isolated, the king ordered trusted guards to take care of the place, but it didn't take long for opportunistic creatures to eliminate this protection and make the place their abode. Knowing this terrible news, the king is secretly summoning adventurers to search for his daughter and bring her back.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The Princess in the Castle PDF

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Rio Ameaçado
Threatened River
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Para subjugar os reinos que não lhe são fieis, o império possui um plano inescrupuloso usando o rio da região.

There are rumors that a war will break out at the hands of the empire because neighboring kingdoms have refused allegiance and submission. One threat is the most recurrent, the river that flows from the empire to the other kingdoms would be poisoned on its frontier, affecting all that are later in its course. The kingdoms have stationed armies on the borders to ensure this is not done, heated meetings are constantly taking place. The crown of one of the kingdoms that can be most affected believes that the empire will do so in a more discreet way and involving arcane spells. As it is not possible to move the guard for espionage, the crown is summoning trusted people to do so, and if necessary, eliminate any threat.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Pegadas na Areia
Tracks in the Sand
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pegadas misteriosas estão surgindo na praia, os moradores próximos estão ficando agitados. Rumores de tesouros e perigos correm. Quem está andando na areia?

It's been a few months since the beach that used to be calm has been bustling. Residents of the nearby town say they see shapes and bustle on the sand when night comes, and when they go to check it out at sunrise, there are only tracks and footprints that the wind quickly hides. Then comes the rumor that they are the souls of an old shipwreck trying to return home and that they ended up getting lost on the beach for not finding the right way. The local innkeeper is interested in this curious fact and intends to discover this mystery by paying whoever dares to investigate it, as his father was one of those who suffered in the marine accident.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Roubo de Azar
Unlucky Theft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alguns ladrões acabam pondo a mão em algo muito acima deles, será que foi algo planejado ou apenas o acaso?

A group of priests transported a valuable sculpture, taking it to the temple in the center of the city, by a misfortune they ended up being stolen by some thieves who disappeared in the alleys. Now they are desperately seeking such a relic, offering a handsome reward to whoever retrieves it.

boardgame.name: Miniaventura: Sussurros na Névoa
Whispers in the Mist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Durante a noite uma névoa densa sai da floresta e cobre a estrada próxima, sussurros e murmúrios vêm junto dela. De quem será essa lamúria?

During the night a dense mist comes out of the forest and covers the nearby road, whispers and murmurs come along with it. Merchants and travelers passing through there began to disappear and rumors of hauntings and monsters in the forest take over the taverns. The last to disappear were some members of a traveling theater, the others remain in the city looking for their lost companions during the day in the forest and at night they tell horror stories to the people.

boardgame.name: Cults & Covens: Vampire
boardgame.description:
A game of vampire coven building and herd management. Players take on the roles of different vampires, each with its own unique abilities, and try to use the villagers to create the most powerful coven. Players must take villager cards from the play area into their herds to feed upon and convert the best members of their herds into vampire minions to join their quest for power and prestige. Players must balance their need to feed with their need to produce powerful vampires from the right families to win.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Vampire is one of the three games included in Cults & Covens.

boardgame.name: White Hat: Special White Hat Promo Card
boardgame.description: This card can be used to replace the standard White Hat card. You will never need more than a single White Hat. The only difference is the artwork.

boardgame.name: Strongholds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Build your home, become part of your world.

Strongholds is a system for helping the players build a home for the SagaBorn Roleplaying System. Wizard’s towers, rogue’s hideouts, and warrior’s fortresses allow the adventurers to make the land their own.

Simple rules to add depth to your tabletop game, Strongholds is a system streamlined enough to fit in any game.

boardgame.name: Rockfort
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rockfort is a 5e supplement which aims to help you save prep time and impress your players.

This product offers you a ready-to-use location, which you can drop in any setting, along with detailed encounters that can become an daventure. All of this supported by maps, to complement your game without the need to prepare.

Here's a summary of what you get in this product:

24-pages PDF gorgeously laid out with amazing artwork
1 location with lore
4 detailed encounters that can become an adventure (4-6h of gameplay)
3 new stat block
1 custom artwork
4 battlemaps with ~50 versions (night, rain, etc)
1 regional map

boardgame.name: Wilderness Encounters & Quests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wilderness Encounters & Quests is a supplement for any fantasy system, with specific guidelines for 5e, which aims to help you save prep time and impress your players.

This product offers you 6 detailed encounters, each with a battlemap, to complement your adventures without the need of having preparation.

Here's a summary of what you get in this product:

22-pages gorgeously laid out with amazing artwork
6 detailed encounters
6 battelamaps with 12 versions (gridded and gridless, 2k resolution)
4 new creatures

boardgame.name: Urban Encounters & Quests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Urban Encounters & Quests is a supplement for any fantasy system, with specific guidelines for 5e, which aims to help you save prep time and impress your players.

This product offers you 6 detailed encounters, each with a battlemap, to complement your adventures without the need of having preparation.

Here's a summary of what you get in this product:

26-pages gorgeously laid out with amazing artwork
6 detailed encounters
6 battelamaps with 12 versions (gridded and gridless, 2k resolution)
4 new creatures

boardgame.name: The Troubled Vale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Troubled Vale is a 5e supplement which aims to help you save prep time and impress your players.

This product offers you a ready-to-use location, which you can drop in any setting, along with detailed encounters that can become an daventure. All of this supported by maps, to complement your game without the need to prepare.

Here's a summary of what you get in this product:

23-pages PDF gorgeously laid out with amazing artwork
1 location with lore
4 detailed encounters that can become an adventure (4-6h of gameplay)
3 new stat block
1 new magic item
1 custom artwork
4 battlemaps with ~40 versions (night, rain, etc)
1 regional map

boardgame.name: Amazing Encounters & Places: The Hunt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Amazing Encounters & Places was on Kickstarter from October 26th to November 26th, 2021. One of its add-ons is "The Hunt", a one-shot for Dungeons and Dragons 5e in which youthe party faces off a powerful hunter: an alien creature with a knack for some good meat.

Here's a summary of what you get in this PDF:

11-pages gorgeously laid out with amazing artwork
An adventure mostly focused on Combat and Exploration, with a few Social interaction opportunities
1 brand new legendary creature with custom artwork
A stat block for each Tier

boardgame.name: Cults & Covens: Werecats
boardgame.description:
Werecats are lycanthropes,(like a werewolf but a cat instead.)
Players take on the roles of different werecats, each with its own unique abilities, and try to use the 50 villager cards to create the most powerful team of werecats. Villagers can be eaten to give strength to your werecats, or turned into werecat minions. Players must balance their need to feed with their need to produce powerful werecats from the right families to win.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Werecats is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.

boardgame.name: ROVE: Reconfigured
boardgame.description:
Download finished… Rewriting operating system… Enhancing core modules… Upgrade complete: Welcome to ROVE 2.0.

A 6-card Module expansion.

When playing with Reconfigured, you can play with the standard or Reconfigured version of each Module. These boosted Modules offer bigger – but not always better – effects to help you explore.

Before playing, choose 1 module of each type to use:

BRAIN or BRAIN 2.0
COIL or COIL 2.0
GRIPPER or GRIPPER 2.0
LASER or LASER 2.0
MOTOR or MOTOR 2.0
SENSOR or SENSOR 2.0

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Thing in the Valley
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thing in the Valley - A terror has come to the valley community of Riversmeet. Farmers, herdsmen, and woodsmen have fallen victim to a mysterious and horrific creature. Amidst the terror, questions go unanswered— what is this terrible fiend, where did it come from, and what is its dark purpose? The call has gone out to summon a band of adventurers to put an end to The Thing in The Valley.

The Thing in the Valley is designed for six, third to fourth level characters using the B/X game rules. This adventure will advance the characters to fourth level by the conclusion.

boardgame.name: The Screaming Temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Screaming Temple: The temple arose in the span of a single night! Tall walls hide a mysterious temple steeped in obscurity. Rumors of incredible wealth, abhorrent evil, and dark magic swirl about its secretive walls. The authorities have shown no interest, yet rumors persist. No priests have been seen, no markings adorn its walls...in fact no person has come out or gone in. The only signs of life are the occasional nightmarish screams that shatter the night.

This Quick Play™ adventure is designed for 4 to 8 characters of 2nd to 4th level. The scenario requires the use of the BX RPG system. Quick Play adventures are designed for a single game session and come complete with everything you need to play including monster reference charts for ease of use for the DM.

boardgame.name: Grave of the Green Flame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grave of the Green Flame is an adventure module for the BX RPG, and designed for a single first or second level character. This module introduces Pacesetter’s SoloSystem™ rules for enhanced individual play.

It was the oldest trick in the book. A man on a dark road asked for directions and you let your guard down. You awake in a nearby inn with a bruised skull and ego. All your possessions are gone, but your courage endures. Helped by the kindly and concerned innkeeper, you are equipped and the chase is on. The bandits fled into the forest, but you will have your vengeance.

Yet there is more to the old forest than some petty bandits. Somewhere inside lies the secret of the Grave of the Green Flame.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Black Wall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the Black Wall is an adventure module for the BX RPG and designed for a single third level character. This module includes Pacesetter’s SoloSystem™ for enhanced individual play.

Your hunt for the fabled Green Flame, a jewel of unparalleled beauty and value, has led you deep into the wild.

Guided by unreliable research and gut instinct you search for an ancient city that has been dead for centuries. Your only clue is that the city is guarded by a towering black wall. Somehow, you know the city must exist and that it surely harbors the Green Flame.

Undaunted, you set yourself to face the horrors and dangers that lie beyond the black wall!

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Red Moon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruins of the Red Moon is a solo module for use with the BX RPG system. This adventure uses the Pacesetter Games & Simulations SoloSystem™ for enhanced individual gaming. The scenario is designed for a single, fourth level player character (PC). Any character class may suc-cessfully navigate the dangers in this module.

The adventure starts with the PC making his way through a desolate mountain range. Late fall has given way to a frigid winter. Snow and freezing temperatures threaten the PC with death by exposure. A blizzard is near and the PC must find shelter to survive the night. As he enters yet another barren valley, a massive and strange structure blocks his path.
This module can be played as a solo dungeon as intended or run as a standard adventure module with a DM and sin-gle player or multiple players. If used with multiple player characters, the PC level range should be reduced to first level.

boardgame.name: Greek Tragedy
boardgame.description:
After the Second World War, Greece became one of the first battlefields between the two super powers – the United States and the Soviet Union – who were wrestling for ideological domination. In 1947, the Truman Doctrine provided American aid to Greece to help contain communism. Greece was in the midst of a civil war between communist fighters and the Government army supported by a coalition of right-wing and centrist forces. Greek Tragedy recreates this conflict in a team card driven format.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: トリック&ゴール (Trick & Goal)
boardgame.description:
Trick & Goal is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a must-follow, fixed trump, one round, trick-taking game where players will earn 2 points for each trick they take and 1 point for each goal they complete.

At the start of the game, 10 goals are revealed from a larger pool of goals. The goals are things such as "play a 4", "lead with a club", or "lose a trick with a K". Some goals may be achieved immediately, and others require waiting until a trick is finished. Once a goal is achieved, it is taken and immediately replaced.

The player with the most points after one hand is the winner.

boardgame.name: Across the Board Horseracing Game
boardgame.description:
Enter a horse race, get your "tickets" and let the game begin.
The game is focused on betting on horses, but during the race you can end up betting more, at the end of the race, the accumulated amount will be divided among the people who have 1 of the 4 "tickets" of the winner horse.

boardgame.name: Manöverspiel Pionierstafette "Immer bereit"
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move one of their two meeples (couriers). They start at a snowman at the lower edge of the game board. The first to reach the flagged space at the "STAB" igloo wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

There are obstacles placed on the black spots at the beginning of the game. The obstacles may only be passed, if a courier gets on the same space as the obstacles. Then he may place the obstacles on any other space he chooses.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mit Kundi gesund und munter durch den Tag
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wir reisen durch Rheinland-Pfalz
boardgame.description:
Game 1 (4 players)
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 in Mainz. The first to reach space 70 back in Mainz wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Game 2 (3 players)
Each player gets 15 produce tokens. The players take turns rolling 3 dice. The results of the dice are added and a corresponding produce token is placed on the city of the same number. If a player isn't able to place a token the result of his next roll is added to the current one. The first player to get rid of all his tokens wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Würfelspiel
boardgame.description:
The players roll the special die to determine the color of their starting and destination spaces. The players then take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the players have to answer questions about traffic rules and other safety issues.

Beside the colors to determine the starting and destination spaces, the die has the following faces:

go 1 space forward (yellow)
go 2 spaces forward (blue)
go 1 space backward (red)
go 5 spaces forward (green)
miss a turn (yellow)
roll again (red)


The first player to reach his destination space wins the game.

The game was published in the October 1971 issue of the GDR magazine "Die ABC-Zeitung".

—user summary

boardgame.name: När då då: Sång och musik
boardgame.description:
A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing trivia related to songs and music.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the text on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Uwaga, spoiler!
boardgame.description:
Uwaga, spoiler! ("Watch out, spoiler!") is the party game for real cinephiles. Check, if you can describe well-known films or tv series without spoilers. And you have only 60 seconds for that! Time, start!

How to describe a movie without spoilers?
That's what "Uwaga, spoiler!" game is about. Draw a card, choose one of two titles, tell about it to your team, without using forbidden words. Who'll be the best reviewer?

And now something for real geeks, pro mode!
Try to describe a title without naming actors, character's names! No time for boredom, try new game modes!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Uwaga, Spoiler! to gra towarzyska dla prawdziwych kinomaniaków. Sprawdź, czy potrafisz opisać znane tytuły bez używania spoilerów. Masz na to tylko 60 sekund! Czas, start!

Jak opowiadać o filmach i serialach tak, by nie zdradzić zbyt wiele?

Na tym właśnie polega wyzwanie gry Uwaga, Spoiler! Wylosuj kartę z tytułem i przedstaw go swojej drużynie, nie używając zakazanych słów! Kto okaże się najlepszym recenzentem?

A teraz coś dla prawdziwych geeków!

Spróbujcie przedstawić tytuł bez wymieniania imion aktorów i bohaterów oraz nazw własnych. Możecie wymyślać nowe zasady gry. Tu nie ma mowy o nudzie!

W grze Uwaga, Spoiler! Waszym zadaniem jest umiejętne naprowadzenie drużyny na wskazany na karcie film lub serial. Do każdego tytułu dodana jest lista spoilerów, których użycie oznacza utratę punktów, więc uważaj na to, co mówisz! Musisz wykazać się kreatywnością i umiejętnie przybliżyć treść danego tytułu, tak aby Twoja drużyna zdobyła jak najwięcej punktów. Macie na to zaledwie 60 sekund. Tylko bez spoilerów, proszę!

Każdy ma takiego znajomego, który jest na bieżąco ze wszystkimi serialami i zna wszystkie filmy. Macie dość spoilerów? Wyzwijcie go na pojedynek o tytuł najlepszego recenzenta! Zagrajcie w Uwaga, Spoiler i przetestujcie swoją filmową wiedzę!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dan Dare Rocket Ball
boardgame.description:
Dan Dare Rocket Ball is a simple game based on the British Science Fiction Comic book hero of the 1950's.

Game play uses small coloured wooden balls, one for each player and players take turns tossing the balls onto a game board divided into small box like compartments. Each compartment has a picture of a planet or space themed object and a score. The player obtains a score by their ball falling into the box.

the winner is the first player accumulating a total score of 100 points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dan Dare Mountains of Mars Expedition
boardgame.description:
Dan Dare Mountains of Mars Expedition is a simple roll and move race game based on the British Science fiction Comic hero from the 1950's.

The playing board is 3 dimensional square based pyramid, made from 4 Triangular sections. Players each have a small coloured peg like playing piece that is inserted into holes in the playing board. Players move by the roll of a dice. The holes create a path up each mountain side, from the mountain base to its apex.

First player to ascend the mountain and reach the top is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Siege of the Eternal Night
boardgame.description:
History repeats itself but no one remembers what happened last time, the silence was interrupted by war songs, the moment had arrived…

Object of the game: Defeat all the enemies (grey squares) on the Battleground grid before the End of the Night (9th Turn).
Roll 2 dice at the beginning of each turn. The results will be used to either deploy troops outside the gate, cast magic spells or launch a crossbow volley towards the enemies.

After Turn 9 count the number of unmarked enemy squares on the Battleground , the total is your score. The lower the score, the better.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 557 - April 2022)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 557
April 2022
Ignorable Theme: What goes into a Villain’s Dungeon?
boardgame.rpg: Good Society: A Jane Austen Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Influencer!: #fame #shame #game
boardgame.description:
Influencer! #fame #shame #game is an action-packed board game, 100% analog, with simple rules and retro charm. The satirical look at the business of influencers, pumped full of clichés like the lips of some social media beauty queens, ensures gaming fun and moments of foreign shame.

You'll roam the city hunting for the most lucrative posts. Get in shape at the gym, chill in the park, or get your wrinkles removed at the beauty doctor. Show it all to your fans, because oddly enough, hundreds of thousands are always interested! A visit to the café will give you new power, and hip mega-hypes offer you chances to get lots of new followers - but do you have time for that? Always choose the best challenges and plan your route. Quickly give your competitors a shitstorm, make an illegal YOLO-posting (...if no one sends the police after you!), and then rush off to the disco for the coolest party-posting ever! Crap, now you have to dodge the groupies blocking your way...

Will you be the first to get 1 million followers?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Red Cathedral: Contractors
boardgame.description:
The construction of St. Basil’s Cathedral is going at a steady pace. The moment has arrived to seek out the best specialists of each guild and to apply their skills and knowledge to turn this monument into something that will even surprise the Tsar himself. It’s necessary to send contractors to the far reaches of Russia to be able to stand out from the competition and achieve victory.

Contractors is the first expansion of The Red Cathedral, the hit game from Shei Santos and Isra Cendrero in which players construct Moscow’s St. Basil’s Cathedral and compete to make the most memorable contribution and win the favor of the Tsar. The expansion is also illustrated by Pedro Soto and Chema Román, two artists inspired by the work of Ivan Bilbin, the Russian artist renowned for his majestic representation of Slavic folklore in his works. The Red Cathedral stands out among recent games for its original rondel mechanism, winning the hearts of thousands of gamers around the world.

The expansion comes in a box that contains almost as much content as the original game and takes the experience into another dimension. In Contractors we find 10 new guilds that can be combined with those from the basic game, 6 additional blueprint cards, and a new card for the solo mode. Many of these new guilds use the Contractors module, which among other things, adds a new board containing a map of Russia. We Will send our contractors throughout Russia to recruit the talent of the best specialists and artisans of the country to aid in the construction of the cathedral.

As in the original game, each of these guilds contains 3 different cards, of which one per guild can be included into the game, meaning that Contractors offers 30 new different ways to play The Red Cathedral. And among other highlights are a black die that can be used alongside the 5 existing dice used to obtain resources, diamonds which serve as a wild-card form of resource, and the contractors, which are Cossack meeples that incorporate a worker placement element into the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 1821: Αγώνας για Λευτεριά
boardgame.description:
After 400 years under Ottoman occupation, the Greeks decide to rebel and claim their freedom. Will they manage to prevail or will they get squashed by the Ottoman empire?

1821: Fight for Freedom is a strategy card game that puts the players in the role of the rebellion's main characters. By playing cards from their hands, the players try to gain control of large areas of Greece and minimize their opponent's potential. Whoever manages to gain control of these areas, is the game's winner!

In the game, the players have cards in their hands with the main characters from Greece's War of Independence. They also have 3 cards in front of them, representing 3 large areas of Greece. Each player, on their turn, may place more units in those areas or discard cards to move the existing units. When units of opposite sides end up next to each other, battles occur which are determined by the units' strength and cards played for support. If a player ends up having a total of 10 or more power in one area, at the beginning of their turn, they gain a control marker in that area. The first player to place a control marker in each area or 5 markers in total, is the winner!

The game is also played with 4 players in teams - 2 vs 2. In this case, the player fight for the control of 4 areas in total and the winning team is the one that either places a control marker in all 4 areas or places 7 control markers in total.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Μετά από 400 χρόνια σκλαβιάς οι Έλληνες αποφασίζουν να ξεσηκωθούν και να διεκδικήσουν την ελευθερία τους. Θα τα καταφέρουν ή θα τους σταματήσουν οι δυνάμεις των Οθωμανών κατακτητών;

Το 1821: Αγώνας για Λευτεριά είναι ένα παιχνίδι στρατηγικής με κάρτες, που βάζει τους παίκτες στον ρόλο των πρωταγωνιστών της Επανάστασης. Παίζοντας τις κάρτες που κρατούν στο χέρι τους, οι παίκτες προσπαθούν να κερδίσουν τον έλεγχο μεγάλων περιοχών της Ελλάδας και να περιορίσουν τη δύναμη του αντιπάλου τους. Όποιος καταφέρει να πάρει τον έλεγχο στις περιοχές αυτές, θα είναι και ο νικητής!

Στο παιχνίδι οι παίκτες έχουν κάρτες στα χέρια τους με τους πρωταγωνιστές της Επανάστασης. Μπροστά τους υπάρχουν 3 κάρτες που αναπαριστούν 3 μεγάλες περιοχές της Ελλάδας. Κάθε παίκτης στη σειρά του μπορεί είτε να κατεβάσει κι άλλες κάρτες στις περιοχές αυτές, είτε να κάψει κάρτες από το χέρι του για να μετακινήσει τις υπάρχουσες μονάδες του. Όταν οι μονάδες του βρεθούν δίπλα απο μονάδες του αντιπάλου, γίνεται μάχη η οποία καθορίζεται από τη δύναμη των μονάδων και τις κάρτες που θα παίξουν οι παίκτες για ενίσχυση. Αν ένας παίκτης, στην αρχή του γύρου του, έχει αθροιστική δύναμη 10 σε μια περιοχή (και μεγαλύτερη από τον αντίπαλο του) τότε τοποθετεί μια μάρκα Νίκης στην περιοχή αυτή. Όποιος τοποθετήσει 1 μάρκα Νίκης σε κάθε περιοχή ή 5 συνολικά, είναι ο νικητής!

Το παιχνίδι παίζεται και με 4 παίκτες σε ομάδες - 2 εναντίον 2. Στην περίπτωση αυτή οι παίκτες μάχονται για τον έλεγχο 4 περιοχών και κερδίζει όποια ομάδα τοποθετήσει μάρκα Νίκης και στις 4 περιοχές ή συνολικά 7.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Brainbox: Senior Moments
boardgame.description:
From the box: "Why should children have all the fun? This Brainbox will help improve observation, memory and conversation skills and is a fabulous trip down memory lane."

This is a Game of the Brainbox series, focused on senior people (in fact, the game displays age as 55+)

It contains 55 Cards, 1 rules card, 1 sand timer and a die.

boardgame.name: Gnome Liberation Front
boardgame.description:
The Gnome Liberation Front is an international community with the mission to free garden gnomes deprived of liberty and leave them in forests far from human property. Sending photos of the gnomes to their former captors is optional. In the game, each player is a GNF member with the only objective to release garden gnomes and place them in the most prosperous areas of the forest to help them to reinsert in their new lives.

The game is played in turns until it is no longer possible to free a new gnome. The player who best locate their released gnomes will win the game. In turns, players must swap, push or rotate tiles to get a pattern. Doing so, they free a gnome and get a new objective card which indicates where to locate the gnomes in a forest tabletop.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Top Trumps: Indiana Jones Mini-Game
boardgame.description:
This 8-card Top Trumps set plays the same as the original game but with only two players. It comes with the following cards:


How to Play a 2-player mini game of Top Trumps using six cards



Indiana Jones
Colonel Dovchenko
Irina Spalko
Marion Ravenwood (1957)
Mutt Williams
Ugha Warrior



Card advertising 4 Top Trumps: Star Wars titles and a "Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" movie magazine.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Ein Flug von München nach Venedig
boardgame.description:
The players draw lots to determine which vehicle they use for their journey. The starting point is Munich. The players take turns to spin and move. The spinner shows separate results for each vehicle. On some spins the slower vehicles may let themselfes be taken along by a faster vehicle.
If a slower vehicle meets a faster vehicle along the way, it may make an extra move using the actual speed of the faster vehicle. On some spaces events hinder the players.

The first player to reach Venice wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the book "Wie Hans von München nach Venedig flog" and "Der Blaue Kinderkalender 1923".

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Original Skaterhappy Card Game
boardgame.description:
Get ready for a real skate session, your physical skills will not be needed.
The practice of Skateboarding requires two parts, the physical and the mental, The Skaterhappy Game Card will challenge your ability to conceive new tricks, which you will be tempted to try.
The objective of the Game is to combine real Skateboarding basic tricks to achieve the most extreme trick among your friends. The trick with the highest score wins the game.

boardgame.name: Dreamers
boardgame.description:
Dreamers is a card game for 2 players, which will make you experience games full of twists and turns. Dreamers offers thrilling and original game mechanics. Depending on the Identity card that you will be assigned at the start of the round, you might be playing with the second player cooperatively or one-on-one.

A game is played over 5 rounds. Each round has a certain number of turns. At the end of each round, both players respectively collect points. At the end of the 5 rounds, the player with the most points wins the game.

Part of Dreamers is all about tension, bluffing, betrayal, and backstabbing. Indeed, at the start of each round, each player randomly collects an Identity card. Depending on their cards, players will have to follow their instincts in order to cooperate or compete. Beware, your feelings may betray you...

If both players draw the Dreamer Identity card, they both will have to open the 3 Gates in order to leave the Dream World and win the round.

If a player draws the Master of Nightmares Identity card, they will have to prevent the second player (a Dreamer) to leave the world of dreams while avoiding being exposed! As for the Dreamer, they will either have to leave the Dream World or expose the Master of Nightmares.


Dreamers est un jeu de cartes pour 2 joueurs, qui vous fera vivre des parties pleines de rebondissements. Dreamers propose des mécaniques de jeu palpitantes et originales. En fonction de la carte Identités qui vous sera attribué en début manche, vous jouerez avec le second joueur en coopération ou en un contre un…

Une partie se déroule en 5 manches. Chaque manche comporte un certain nombre de tours. À la fin de chaque manche, les joueurs cumulent des points de fin de manche. À la fin des 5 manches, le joueur qui obtient le plus de points remporte la partie.
Une partie de Dreamers repose sur de la tension, du bluff, de la trahison et des coups bas. En effet, au début de chaque manche, chaque joueur récupère aléatoirement une cartes Identités. En fonction de cette carte, les joueurs devront suivre leur instinct afin de coopérer ou de s’affronter. Attention, vos émotions pourront vous trahir…
Si les deux joueurs tirent la carte Identités Rêveur, ils devront ouvrir les 3 Portes Rêves afin de quitter le monde des rêves et de remporter la manche.
Si un joueur tire la carte Identités Maitre des cauchemars, il devra empêcher le second joueur (Rêveur) de quitter le monde des rêves en évitant de se faire démasquer ! Quant au Rêveur, il devra soit quitter le monde des rêves, soit démasquer le Maitre des cauchemars.

boardgame.name: Braveheart Solitaire
boardgame.description:
You are in command of the Scottish armies in their bid for independence from the English Monarchy.

Lead your people to freedom as they cheer your name “Braveheart!”

The English outnumber your army in both battles, so your decisions require some outstanding leadership. If you expect to win the day, the decisions are yours…

Braveheart Solitaire, you take the role of William Wallace or Robert the Bruce against an opposing English army. There are two unique battles, Falkirk and Bannockburn. Within the two battles, you have six opportunities to defeat a challenging English Bot plus six chances to beat a difficult English Bot. The two grand battles provide a player with a total of twenty-four plays to claim victory.

All you need to provide is a die, a pen, and a sense of adventure to play.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Pledge of Honor
boardgame.description:
Pledge of Honor is an expansion for Heroes of the Nam bringing more tactical combat to Vietnam. Lock 'n Load Tactical squad-level Series, with its fast-paced, intense impulse system, drops you right into the middle of furious jungle firefights and all-out, building-to-building assaults. Pledge of Honor depicts the US Army, US Marines, the Army of the Republic of Vietnam, and ANZAC combat operations against the People’s Army of Vietnam, the North Vietnamese Army, and the Viet Cong, as they fought across South Vietnam.

Pledge of Honor Battlepack brings the forces from the Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN), the United States Army and Marines, as well as their valiant Anzac allies from Australia and New Zealand, take on determined enemies from the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) and the unpredictable Viet Cong (VC).

Pledge of Honor Battlepack includes 8 scenarios and 1 new map, bringing to life powerfully armed Squads are at the vanguard of all actions, spurred on by daring Leaders and other unique individuals such as Snipers, Medics, Corpsmen, Chaplains, Advisors and, of course, Heroes, whose unique skills and sudden appearance can alter the tide of any battle. Helicopters, tanks, and armored personnel carriers (APCs) also join the fight.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Nam

boardgame.name: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 3rd Edition
boardgame.description:
Five Leagues from the Borderlands is a solo adventure wargame where you take the role of a warband of heroes and adventurers, and explore a grim world full of monsters, enemies, creeping malice, and exciting quests.

The third edition updates:


New rules for spell-casting, along with a new Mystic Hero and 30+ spells



New non-human Hero backgrounds



New rules for Delves, i.e. dungeon crawling added



New rules including Proficiency Tests, Story Points, Creating your map, and Hideouts



Complete overhaul of the Campaign Turn
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 2nd Edition

boardgame.name: Disney's 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea Electric Quiz Game
boardgame.description:
A typical 1950's electic matching quiz game. Comes with 6 cards printed on both sides, each containing 12 illustrations and 12 descriptions. There are 5 additional Kiddie Quiz cards included in this set.

Players select a quiz board to use and answer trivia questions. Right answers are indicated by the quiz board lights.

To play, hold one selector tip in your left hand and place it on a contact station, or question. With the card above, we will select ‘Life Boat’ in the upper left corner. Then, holding the other selector tip in your right hand, place it on another contact station, or answer.

In this case, it would be the metal disk just below ‘Anchor’ on the upper side of the Nautilus, between the Vertical Fin and the Rudder & Propeller. When you have made this final contact, the circuit is completed and the red light will glow to indicate a correct answer. If you were to place the selector tip in your right hand on the wrong metal disc, say in the lower left corner by the Anchor, nothing would happen, and you would have given a wrong answer. Play would then pass to the next player.

boardgame.name: Kirby and the Forgotten Land
boardgame.description:
Join Kirby on an unforgettable journey
Float off on an all-new adventure as the powerful puffball, Kirby. Explore 3D stages as you discover a mysterious world, save the kidnapped Waddle Dees, and defeat the ferocious Beast Pack. Hope you’re hungry for an unforgettable adventure! - Kirby and the Forgotten Land official website

boardgame.name: Here to Slay: The Unstable Unicorn Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Party Leader card automatically added to pledges of anyone who backed a previous Unstable Games / Ramy Badie project and available as an add-on purchase.

Card text:
"The Unstable Unicorn has no class. At the beginning of your turn, you may choose another player's Party Leader card. The Unstable Unicorn's kill is that Party Leader card's skill until your next turn."

boardgame.name: That Old Wallpaper
boardgame.description:
In That Old Wallpaper, you attempt to recover the wall of a house with wallpaper, matching as many patterns as you can.

In the game, a number of locations are available where wallpaper cards will come up for grabs. Each turn, players simultaneously choose a location, and if they're the only one to pick a location, they get the card or cards in that location. If you choose the same location as someone else, each of you receives a "hazy memory" card that features a wallpaper pattern along only one edge instead of along all four edges.

When you receive regular wallpaper cards, you must add them to your other played cards immediately, ideally matching the pattern halves to create a complete pattern. Patterns come in four colors, with each color having two sizes. A wild pattern is also available, which seems kind of weird, but so be it. To end a turn, deal a new wallpaper card to each location, which means that some locations will likely have more cards than other ones.

At game's end, use your hazy memory cards to complete patterns on the edge of your wallpaper, then score for each color of pattern. The score of a pattern is the number of large symbols of that color multiplied by the number of small symbols, so if you don't have at least one large and small symbol, you score nothing for that color!

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Shake That City
boardgame.description:
Welcome, city planners! Design the best city block using patterns from the new and exciting "Cube Shaker". You'll place a mix of tiles to help grow the thriving city. The best design wins the game!

Shake That City is played over 15 rounds. For each of the first twelve rounds, the active player shakes the Cube Shaker, then presses the slider to drop nine cubes in a 3 x 3 pattern. That player picks one of the building colors available from the pattern and places the corresponding building tile(s) on their player board in the same pattern as the cubes revealed by the shaker. The other players then pick any building color other than the one the active player picked, then place matching colored tiles in the matching pattern on their board. For the final three rounds, all players can pick whatever color/pattern they wish from the shaken cubes. What are you trying to do?

• Roads wants to connect to an edge of the board.
• Factories wants to be next to other factories and roads.
• Homes want to be placed in clusters that are as small as possible — the smallest being a single tile — so long as they're not next to a factory.
• Parks wants to be next to homes and factories.
• Shops score increasingly more the closer they are placed to the city center, but if they're not placed on an edge, they need to be adjacent to a road connected to the board's edge in order to score. Without road access, you'll have no products to sell!

At game's end, players earn points for tile-placement combinations and for the completed bonus point tiles around the edge of their board.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rogue & Gambit
boardgame.description:
Two iconic characters join the ranks of the X-Men with this character pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol! Born with a power that is both blessing and curse, the mutant Rogue can absorb the powers and memories of anyone she touches. This remarkable but devastating power allows her to wield the abilities of her foes but leaves them depleted— or worse. Prolonged contact with her skin drains the vital energy from those she touches. Afraid to harm those close to her, Rogue fled her past life. A runaway from the American South, she started her career as a member of the Brotherhood of Mutants under Mystique before joining the X-Men to fight on the side of good.

Remy LeBeau is Gambit, a dashing scoundrel with the mutant power to accelerate the molecular energy of an object, transforming mundane items into kinetically-charged explosives. Raised by a gang of New Orleans street thieves, Gambit is a master thief and former member of the Thieves’ Guild. Forced into the employ of the Marauders, Gambit had an unwitting hand in the destruction of the Morlocks. Wracked by guilt, his life of wandering ended when he met Storm and him finding a new family as one of the X-Men. Now fighting to protect others, he dishes out punishment with his bo staff and trademark playing cards. With a little kinetic enhancement, Gambit always has the winning hand.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Juggernaut
boardgame.description:
This character pack brings the Juggernaut to life on the tabletop with a beautifully- sculpted Juggernaut miniature, as well as a stat card outlining all of his abilities. If his brute strength isn’t enough, three Team Tactic cards unlock even more ways for him to be a disruptive force on the battlefield.

Cain Marko is the Juggernaut, a human wrecking ball of unstoppable force who lays waste to everything unlucky enough to be in his path. He was once an average human before discovering the Crimson Gem of Cyttorak, a conduit to the power of the deity of the Crimson Cosmos, that transformed Marko into the Juggernaut. Possessing unfathomable strength and durability, he is among the strongest physical beings alive. Juggernaut has endless strength and kinetic power, with the ability to shatter mountains, and a mystical force field makes him impervious to any harm. Once he gains momentum, nothing on Earth can stop his advance.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 2400: Battle Moon
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

They call it “Battle Moon” — a domed arena on a lawless rock, where captives fight robots, beasts, professional gladiators, or even their own friends, all for the amusement of the hyper-rich. Use it as a single-episode scenario for captive combatants or would-be rescuers — or as a tutorial and rules reference to help run and play out fight scenes in an RPG without “hit points.”

Battle Moon is a super-slim, self-contained, lo-fi sci-fi RPG one-shot scneario inspired by Beyond Thunderdome, The Hunger Games, and Battle Royale (in spaaaaace). It's 3 pages and a cover, fitting on two sides of a letter-sized page, with rules based on the free 24XX SRD. (Check out the free Inner System Blues for a sample.) But even if you don't plan to run the scenario, you may want to check out the expanded explanation of combat rules and procedures.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – X-23 & Honey Badger
boardgame.description:
Laura Kinney, or X-23, is the 23rd attempt by the Facility, an offshoot of the Weapons Plus Program, to create a genetic copy of the mutant Wolverine. She was born to be a living weapon and had minimal human contact to enhance her savage and killer instincts. X-23 is a peerless fighter and assassin with all the mutant abilities of Wolverine, including a superhuman ability to heal from any injury, lightning-fast reflexes, and retractable adamantium-coated claws in her hands and feet.

Alchemax Genetics created Gabrielle Kinney from the building blocks of X-23’s genetic makeup. She was trained by Alchemax to serve as a bodyguard and elite fighter who possessed the same regenerative ability as Laura Kinney and Wolverine, as well as retractable bone claws. Her creators further enhanced her to be impervious to pain through an Alchemax nanite therapy, a painful process that shortened the lifespan of its subjects. She ultimately broke free from her cruel makers in Alchemax with the aid of her rebellious sisters and assumed the identity of Honey Badger as a member of the X-Men.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Crashed Sentinel Terrain Pack
boardgame.description:
The mutant-hunting creations of Doctor Bolivar Trask, the Sentinels are towering robotic enemies of all mutant-kind. While they are technologically advanced and possess advanced energy weapons, the ability to fly, and sensors designed to track down mutants, they are not indestructible. Working together, a team can overpower and destroy these enormous machines.

But the Sentinels learn from every engagement. With each confrontation, they learn and adapt their tactics for future battles. Terminate one Sentinel—terminate one thousand—it makes no difference. Their numbers are too great.

Enhance the battlefield with the Crashed Sentinel Terrain Pack. Whether your crisis takes place in the modern day or the far-flung days of a future past, the detailed wreck of this metal giant is a perfect addition to your games of Marvel: Crisis Protocol.

boardgame.name: Das neue geographische Würfelspiel
boardgame.description:
The Players take turns rolling 3 letter-dice. Now the players have to find a city or river with one of the 3 letters shown. The first to do so with each letter get to stick one of his pins to the map.

The first player to get rid of all his pins (8 to 12) wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to "Meidingers Kinderkalender 1927".

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die Walfisch-Jagd
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 51 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose game coins.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Tempo! Das neue Märchenspiel
boardgame.description:
The players take turns rolling an moving. They start at space 1 and have to get to space 100 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Soulgivers: The Soulcrusher
boardgame.description:
The Soulcrusher is the 11th hero to reach the battlefield.

Transform the Souls into a destructive weapon and hit your enemies from afar with the Soulcrusher.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Soulcrusher and a Specter Soulcrusher.

This expansion is a Kickstarter exclusive, and it is available only during Gravity Games Kickstarter campaigns and special events.

boardgame.name: Soulgivers: The Aeger
boardgame.description:
The Aeger is the 12th hero to reach the battlefield.

Control the Decay and consume your enemies with the Aeger’s dark knowledge.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Aeger and a Specter Aeger.

boardgame.name: Soulgivers: The Whisperer
boardgame.description:
The Whisperer is the 13th hero to reach the battlefield.

Encourage your hero and subdue your enemies whispering ancient litanies with the Whisperer.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Whisperer and a Specter Whisperer.

boardgame.name: Soulgivers: The Gatekeeper
boardgame.description:
The Gatekeeper is the 14th hero to reach the battlefield.

Surprise the enemy with new paths for your heroes thanks to the Gatekeeper’s Gates.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Gatekeeper, a Specter Gatekeeper and four Gate Modifiers.

boardgame.name: Escape 2222
boardgame.description:
In a dehumanised future, where every trace of culture dies one at a time, a powerful corporation sends its time thieves to the past with the mission to reshape crucial historical events according to their own vision. Their goal being to erase the very idea of revolution.

Professor Constant and his team created their own time machine to stop that corporation. But no one heard from them since their last mission which took place during the French Revolution.

In 2222, you and your group find refuge in what happens to be the Professor's lab…

The game includes 2 chapters lasting about 120 minutes each.
It features 60+ minutes of original audio fiction, 30+ puzzles, 24 historical facts to uncover and listen to.
Play with your mobile device or with the online web interface. No rules to read, the game begins as soon as you open the box.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Conquest of Indarium
boardgame.description:
Teleported to a new world, the Players find mounts and gain the ability to ride them, causing them to become Riders. Riders move their Mount Pieces space to space on tiles based on the roll of a d4, discovering more of the world as they do by setting new tiles when they reach the end of a tile. Riders take different actions depending on the type of space that is landed on when they run out of movement. These actions cause you to gain items, equipment or spells, meet interesting characters, participate in wacky events, or fight Akuwu which are the monsters of the land in order to either Liberate towns or remove them from the road. When fighting Akuwu, Riders use their equipped equipment and miscellaneous items and spells to attempt to have more Kapow than the Akuwu they are fighting, rolling dice when necessary to raise Kapow by the roll, in order to defeat them and gain rewards that add to the Riders worth. Riders have 16 turns to gain the most worth before the final Boss appears, whether it be in the form of pure Gilver obtained throughout the game or assets such as items, equipment, spells and Liberated Towns that are automatically sold at the end of the game. The Riders must defeat the boss, either together or on their own to reap the rewards or else face the consequences of failure.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus
boardgame.description:
Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus is a target game based on the Science fiction Comic book hero Dan Dare.

The target board features a base that is standing on wooden stands. Weird and wonderful space creatures with prehistoric and reptilian features sit atop of the base.

Players win the game by knocking down the space creatures using a primitive spring loaded gun that fires a wooden bead.

boardgame.name: コンクエスター (ConqueStar)
boardgame.description:
コンクエスター (ConqueStar) is a science fiction game from Japan. The game was published in a wide cylinder.

Players each run a well-known family business throughout the galaxy. However, they are also notorious planetary collectors behind the scenes.

In this newly discovered galaxy of unique stars, players compete to see who can best collect stars!

Through the means of trades and invasion, add stars to your valuable planetary collection!

あなたたちは銀河に名の知れ渡る宇宙実業家一族です。
しかし！なんとその裏の顔は、悪名高い惑星コレクターでもあるのです。
このたび発見されたユニークな星の集まる銀河で、誰が一番うまく星をコレクシ
ョンできるか競争することにしました！
交易と侵略を駆使してより貴重な惑星コレクションを増やしましょう！
user summary

boardgame.name: Assumption
boardgame.description:
Assumption is a game from Japan.

On the island of Mariehamn, which is surrounded on all sides by great powers across the sea, 3 tribes (Red/Blue/Yellow) vie for supremacy. Players, each as the chancellor of a major power, manipulate informers and intervene in conflicts for their country's profits.

海を挟んだ四方を大国に囲まれたマリエハム島では、赤/青/黄の3つの民族が島の覇権を争っていた。プレイヤーは大国の宰相となり、内通者を操り、紛争に介入し、自国の利益の増大を目指す。
user summary

boardgame.name: Orion's Gate
boardgame.description: Rules for giant space ship or naval battles with lots of customization. Each round the ships can move, cruise, ram and shoot depending on what type of ship it is. The different ship types is scouts, fighters, destroyers and battleships. The game ends after four rounds and the player that controls most objective markers wins.

boardgame.name: Katz und Maus
boardgame.description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and must reach space 60 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Tributo de Sangre: Annual, 1921
boardgame.description:
Tributo de Sangre (Tribute of Blood) is an operational game for two players, framed in the colonial conflict that confronted the Spanish Army with the hardened local tribes of the Rif (North of the Moroccan Sultanate) in 1921-22.

The game focuses on the peak phase of the conflict, starring the Campaign before and after the Disaster of Annual (1921), which caused the death in combat of thousands of young Spanish soldiers. A tragic episode, which would decisively mark the political and military future of Spain during that same decade and part of the following.

TdS is an operational level game, with a "point to point" system guided by cards. It includes 3 short Scenarios plus the entire Campaign Game (22 turns):

- Scenario 1: "El Desastre"
- Scenario 2: "Evitando el Desastre"
- Scenario 3: "Reconquista del Kert"
- Campaign Scenario: "Campaña de Annual; 1921-22"

A simulation of an irregular and asymmetric warfare, with interesting innovations in mechanics and interactions.

boardgame.name: Luft-Rennen
boardgame.description: Each player gets a special air vehicle on a separate track. The slower vehicles get a start bonus. The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to arrive on space 50 on his track wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Sector 18
boardgame.description:
Sector 18 is a 1-2 player, sci-fi, tactical space warfare game.

Rival factions are fighting over the territory in this sector, which holds precious resources. You must conquer planets, build ships, upgrade your base and ships, defend against enemy advances and ultimately destroy the enemy’s base to claim this sector for their own!

Features multiple asymmetrical factions, each with varying abilities and tactical strengths. During gameplay, players will take turns performing an action from the list of available actions on their base and shield cards. New actions are unlocked as the player spends Resources to upgrade their base and shield cards.

You win by reducing your enemies base to 0 health.
You lose by letting your base fall to 0 health.

boardgame.name: Borstel und die Kräuterkobolde
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 37 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as a supplement in the book of the same name.

boardgame.name: Factory Funner: Wood Box Insert Upgrade
boardgame.description: A wooden storage upgrade option offered by BoardGameTables.com for their 2022 reprint of the game.

boardgame.name: Doubloon Lagoon
boardgame.description:
Ahoy privateer! A hurricane the likes of which ye’ve never seen is bearing down on Doubloon Lagoon, the site of the lost wreck of the treasure-teeming megaship, The Dorado. Rumors have it that the storm is shaking the booty free of the clutches of the reefs, and rife for the taking. However, ye not be the only pirates in these parts, and the hurricane winds are filling sails, me hearty. So get all hands on deck and beat those bilge rats to the treasure, or send them to the briney deep.

This is a grid-based, pirate-themed, battle royale sailing game that uses mechanics such as wind direction, dice battling, and movement economy to race and battle your friends to be the last ship afloat with the most treasure aboard when the storm hits. You command 3 ships; a slow and heavily armored/gunned Galleon, a balanced Brigantine, and a weak yet fast Sloop. Each of these ships have different attributes in regards to bonuses they receive in movement, cannon power, and defenses.

Rather than chess-style movement, each turn the wind will (or may not) change direction, effecting all of the ships ability to sail on certain headings. Learn the actual points of sail used by sailers to maximize your movement and chart the best course to play the wind and best your opponents.

Each turn, a randomly generated chest of treasure will surface somewhere in the play area, creating an ever shifting goal for you while you fend off other players and dodge cannon fire. Win the game by being the last one afloat with most treasure when the turn-based timer runs out and the hurricane hits. Randomly generated wind, treasure locations, unnavigable-island tiles, and up to 8 players make for different play styles and outcomes with every session.

boardgame.name: 人狼コロシアム (Jinro Colosseum)
boardgame.description:
人狼コロシアム (Jinro Colosseum) is a werewolf style card game from Japan.

Players start with a hand of character cards, play one form their hand, and draw another from a circle of cards. Players have two lives, and try to attack each other. If a player loses both lives, they are out of the game. If they draw a werewolf from the circle, they are also eliminated.

The game is won if one player is left standing. Otherwise, the player with the highest ranking character in hand is the winner.

The game comes with a standard deck of 16 cards for a quick, game, another 32 cards to be added to make an advanced game for 20 minutes. Finally, a set 5 cards makes a delux set for a longer game.

The standard deck includes characters such as Citizens, Fortune Teller, Bodyguard x2, Hunter, Tough Guy, Jester, Monk, and Werewolf. The advanced deck has more like Doctor, Assassin, Magician, Hermit, Lover, Knight, Sniper, Revolutionary, Queen, Musician, Mad Wolf, White Wolf. The delux set is a Lone Wolf, Black Cat, Cow Man, Demon Fox, and a Demon.
user summary

boardgame.name: Magnum Opus (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
マグヌム・オプス (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
巨作 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
曠世巨作 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
마그눔 오푸스 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
boardgame.description:
The Magnum Opus set was released near the end of 2018, featuring six cards designed by winners of some of the most prestigious tournaments. It was only available to people who were able to attend the Magnum Opus event. Since then, many players have found it hard to get hold of the set, so we have re-released it with brand new art, updated wording, and modernized templates and glyphs.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: System Gateway (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)

boardgame.name: One-Stop Grocery Shop
boardgame.description:
This polyomino tile-laying, push your luck game is a two dimensional retelling of the classic grocery store dilemma- "Should I carry more bags with fewer items inside, or can I just pile it all in one bag and carry it all at once?"

Each player will start with a gridded card of their standard grocery bag, with a communal field of polyomino foods between them, separated into departments by color. On their turn, they will roll a die dictating which department they must draw from and place within the confines of their bag. You may exceed out of the "top" of your bag, but when you do so you risk dropping items or worse, the dreaded "bag rip."

At their discretion, players may draw another bag card from a pile (aka bags just in your car) to create more space to carry more items into the house. These bags have different dimensions - such as a convenience store bag, wine shop bag, clothing store bags, recycled totes, and more.

Scoring is resolved at the end of the game by totaling the scores indicated on each of the food items that you successfully brought to the house, dividing by the number of bags you used, and subtracting the scores of any of the food items that were dropped or suffered a bag rip.

boardgame.name: Interplanetary: Space Race – Expansion 3
boardgame.description:
The third expansion for Interplanetary, titled Space Race, enables competitive gameplay, transforming the experience into a two-player euro-game.

This is not a standalone expansion as both expansion 1 and 2 are required to play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Interplanetary: A giant hop for Squeakind
